Reviews.Title: “Clean, Convenient, Just Lacking Charm”
Reviews.Author: MattB
Reviews.Content: Typical Marriott quality, but an awkwardly set up lobby, that lacks the warmth and charm, and maybe the quirkiness that one may find in boutique hotels in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but not great, especially for the money”
Reviews.Author: raggazza1
Reviews.Content: The Marriott now has very spiffy elevators that, once figured out, make it very efficient to get from the lobby to your floor. Check-in was fine but we were immediately hit with an up-sell to a room with a view. The room was small, bathroom was OK clean but not spotless, no refrig in room and there is a separate fee for internet. There was low water pressure in the sink and the cold water faucet leaked all over the counter. Room service did not replenish the coffee supplies. They failed to deliver the morning paper. I expect more for my money at this price point. It is convenient to the French Quarter, the St. Charles Ave. streetcar and the waterfront. It is a longer walk to the Convention Center.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a good price!”
Reviews.Author: Ellis3752
Reviews.Content: The lobby bar service was my only true complaint; they just need more help. The ones they have now are fine, just over-worked. Otherwise, the rooms, cleanliness, beds, location of hotel are all great!

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality at its Finest!”
Reviews.Author: swardrn
Reviews.Content: The rooms were excellent; however, the bathroom was very tiny. My neighbors were very loud, but I was moved immediately and thanks to the kind staff it was a smooth transition. We were also given privaledges to the executive lounge for the inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: JeffS375
Reviews.Content: I am a little behind the ball posting my review but better later than never. My wifes birthday was approaching and decided to throw her a surprise birthday party. As a local from New Orleans I had several hotels to select from. I will be honest, reading some of the reviews scared me a little but decided to take the plunge. Glad I did. Granted, I reserved the JW bi-level suite for the party to host about 45 people and my fears of the rooms were quickly put to rest. Yes, the hotel can use some updating to include the room decor (previous reviews) but the hotel was overall clean and very professional. The moment I arrived the JW was on it. From the valet, the front desk, bellman, etc. everyone was top notch. The amount of "stuff" I had brought was no longer a worry. Everyone took the worry from me and place it on the JW staff. Even throughout the day until guests arrived the staff followed up in every way. Personal visits to the room, phone calls, extra tables and whatever else was needed was no problem for the JW. Thank you JW and my hat goes off to you.

Reviews.Title: “top location at great price”
Reviews.Author: FlatbushFlyer
Reviews.Content: except for the almost non-existent lobby area (where you're not going to hang out anyway), this jw marriott is a good choice, if nothing else - for it's location on Canal within a very short walk of the riverfront, french quarter and street car lines. with prices regularly hovering around $125 for a larger corner room, it's a good value as well. worth noting is the fact that the rooms (at least ours) had outstanding sound insulation. we had some noisy revelers on our floor, in fact next door to us, but once they stepped inside their room, you couldn't hear a peep. housekeeping kept the room absolutely spotless and was attentive to our request for extra coffee service items. staff were very friendly. the bed was comfy, bathroom amenities were nice with the sole exception during our vist being the low water pressure in the shower. we'd return to this jw marriott for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property Geared to Conventions and Conferences”
Reviews.Author: ChaChaCha_MI
Reviews.Content: I requested a room on a high floor with a view and was given a very nice corner room with a view of French Quarter, at a cost. The staff at was very rigid and unaccomodating (especially since I'm perks member). The property is within walking distance to all the downtown attractions of New Orleans, including the French Quarter, Harrah's, Du Monde's, etc. If you prefer to ride, the trolley stops in front of the hotel. The layout of the hotel is odd, with the small lobby and drive in the back. They indicated that they are preparing for a major remodel. Be prepared to circle the block to get to check-in. The location of the Marriott across the street also ads to the confusion, but traveling is an adventure. Shula's is in the hotel and has the best cobb salad I've ever eaten. I grabbed lunch at Shula's before heading out for the day. The staff was wonderful and the food was amazing. I have access to the lounge for Marriott perks members. I was amazed to find that it closes on the weekends. None of the other properties I've ever visited had such limited hours. The food was good, but there was a cost for drinks. Soft drinks were free. It was not set up for the casual pleasure traveler that travels on the weekends. Room service is a bit limited, since it come through Shula's. All in all, the property was clean and pleasant. The location was good. The staff was a bit rigid and not extremely friendly, but did a good job. I'm not sure if I'd stay at this property again, but may look around at other locations to get a wider feel for New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Troy D
Reviews.Content: just stayed a night here very nice hotel. Comfortable beds with flexible night lights which made it nice for reading. Good location only couple blocks from bourbon and short walk to riverwalk area. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay next to the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: jscul
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night using Marriott reward points and enjoyed our stay. The room was on the smaller side, but comfortable enough for our party of four. As other reviews note, the bathroom is very small, and I refuse to pay for internet access, but I otherwise don't have any other complaints. The service we received at both check-in and check-out was excellent. We did have one problem during our stay; when we woke up there was no hot water in the bathroom. A call to the front desk got an immediate apology and a credit to our bill, and an engineer was knocking on my door within 5 minutes. He had it fixed very quickly; I suspect some fuse had flipped off or something. We ordered room service breakfast, and it was delivered promptly within the time frame we selected. The continental breakfast was $12, and two of them included enough food to feed the four of us. We are light breakfast eaters, though. I would stay here again, but only at a discounted rate. The charges for internet service and valet parking, added to rack rate, would add up very quickly in an area where there is a lot of comparable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but no breakfast for guests.?”
Reviews.Author: lilsnipper
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location! Walking distance to everything but not noisy. Ask for a corner room, they are considerably larger! The bed is very comfortable! What i dont understand is why the continental breakfast was $20 per person?? Thats a little rediculous considering even best westerns give u that as a guest. We got a great rate under AAA so i would say our overall value was good. We also went to the spa here, serenity spa, for a couples massage. We were very pleased with that as well!

Reviews.Title: “The Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: The Marriott New Orleans on Canal Street sets in the heart of sightseeing and shopping. It's just a half a block from the famous Acme Oyster House and only three blocks from Bourbon Street, French Quarters. You can walk to the Mardi Gras events. Parking near Bourbon Street during Mardi Gras is virtually impossible. The staff members are warm and gives you the southern hospitallity of New Orleans. The rooms are excellent and lives up to the high standards of Marriott. You are justs a few blocks from Harrah's casino and the riverfront, where you can take a boat ride on Lake Pontchartrain. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Not my best stay at a JWMarriott!”
Reviews.Author: Flower47Nevada
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review while still at the hotel! I transferred to this hotel from Harrahs as they were booked up (wonderful stay there - see my review) I am a Marriott Rewards member. Pros - great room, great location, nice and helpful staff Cons - tiny, tiny bathroom, internet access - awful (used my phone to access work emails as using laptop took so long), hot water using it for first time was very cool- had to run it for 10 mins for it to warm up, room service for breakfast - if you put out your order before midnight - check that it was taken as soon as you get up - ours was not taken and we had a tour to go on - their recovery from this was fast but when we called down they were not surprised!

Reviews.Title: “General Manager, southern gentleman”
Reviews.Author: brenda1222
Reviews.Content: Checking was a breeze, the staff most helpful with checking me and received a great room with a view of the river (thanks to other reviews I was well prepared and the guy checking me in seemed appreciative) albeit the view was between buildingsâ€¦ The room was a corner room and it was fine, clean- especially for the amount of time I spent in it. I was sitting at the conciergeâ€™s desk which was empty at the moment when the General Manager asked if he could help. (Thank you, thank you, and thank you!) I told him where I had eaten, where I had plans on eating at and where I couldnâ€™t get in at a decent time and he completely appreciated my efforts as well as understood my mission. First he called the restaurant I couldnâ€™t get in before 9 (Bayona) and he made me a reservation for me at 7 for the same night. Thank you, again. AND then suggested a restaurant not on my listâ€¦ if was magnificent and I am very grateful!

Reviews.Title: “Where did JW go?”
Reviews.Author: Txchap
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this location for one night and have to say am a bit surprised this is considered a JW Marriott. Hotel is nice....dont get me wrong, but does not have the same level of service and style that other JW locations have. This should be a standard Marriott hotel. Staff was very nice, but room was fair. Beds not the best and the bathroom had issues; I should not have to hold the toilet flush handle down for 5 seconds just to get the thing to do its job. Nor should I have to stand in a foot of water in the shower because the drain is so slow! Little things that we really should not have to deal with at a JW. If I go back to New Orleans, not sure I would go back to this location as there are many other options close by.

Reviews.Title: “Gives Marriott a bad name”
Reviews.Author: roogus
Reviews.Content: We arrived at a busy time before check-in. The bell captain was totally overwhelmed with hundreds of bags, valet situation was a MESS. Our room had a strong musty moldy smell coming from the AC- got out of there as soon as possible the next day only to have more chaos at the valet.

Reviews.Title: “Good but getting to be time for renovation”
Reviews.Author: flipper95
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night, and enjoyed my stay. The hotel is large and full service as one would expect for a JW Marriott. The service and front desk staff were excellent. My room was fair size, very comfortable bed, good amenities. I enjoyed the use of the concierge floor (gold/platinum MR account). My only caveat for this hotel is that its showing some age in the decor and furnishings. My room had a nice new tv but the furnishings were looking tired. The room could have used some better air circulation as well, but overall I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, quiet rooms”
Reviews.Author: H0lidayr0ad
Reviews.Content: While the address of the hotel is on Canal Street, the main entrance to the lobby and for vehicle drop off is off of Common Street. The rooms have been nicely renovated and include a large flat screen TV with several channels in HD, bedside lamps with built in power outlets and handy snake lights over the bed for reading. The fee for Wi Fi access in rooms in $15/night, but as a Marriott Rewards guest I was allowed to draw from a fishbowl and the prize for my stay was free Internet access. My room was on the 16th floor and overlooked Common Street. The floor and surrounding rooms were quiet. You could hear some city noise such as an occasional siren from outside but it didnâ€™t interfere with sleep. As others have noted, the bathroom is small with the door opening to within a few inches of the toilet. The location of the hotel is hard to beat as it is within a short walk of the French Quarterâ€™s many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this hotel ... but they nickel and dime you to death!”
Reviews.Author: treadburners67
Reviews.Content: The J.W. Marriott is beautiful! From the murals to the chandeliers to the view from the upper floors, simply beautiful! We stayed for several days and enjoyed almost every minute. The exception to that statement comes from the fact that they charge for every little thing. We had a room on the 28th floor, Concierge level booking, and were told by Central Booking that internet (in our room) would be free. No! It's $14.95 ... PER DAY ... PER DEVICE! My husband and I both had laptops and the kids both had ipods and everyone had to agree to the $14.95 a day charge for internet service. And it's not even great/reliable service. There were plenty of times it didn't work at all and we had to call IBHAN and complain and they would contact the hotel "engineers" to fix the problem. It would be okay for a little while and then it would get slower and slower and slower....... or not work at all. Rooms: We had a single room w/ 2 double beds. The beds were small but comfortable. The bathroom was small but very clean and had plenty of counter space. You get a coffee maker but no microwave and no refrigerator. Location: Two blocks from Bourbon. Close enough to enjoy the party but far enough away to leave the chaos and noise behind when you return to your room. CVS and Walgreens are just 2 blocks up the street, as is McDonald's, IHOP and Krystals. Tipping: If you are opposed to tipping for services, do NOT stay here. On the first day of our stay, we had tipped out to the guy that helped unload our car, to the guy that brought the stuff to our room (not the same guy), to the guy that later brought the car back down to us that evening, to the concierge lounge staff in the a.m. AND the p.m. They do not loan out luggage carts and allow the guests to handle their own luggage. Parking: $35 per day. I stayed here years ago when it was the Le Meridien and I believe the parking was only $9 a day. Why hotels in NOLA charge so much for parking is a complete mystery to me. They are storing your car. Not washing it, not waxing it, not servicing it ... just storing it. The staff in the Concierge Lounge are wonderful. Very friendly, very helpful, and always working very hard to keep up with the needs of the guests at breakfast and evening hor devours. The coffee was always fresh and the food was fantastic. The breakfast each morning was the same (eggs, oatmeal, bacon, bread items, pastries, cereal, fruit, yogurt, meats, cheeses, fresh juice, etc. Evening hor devours (only available at Concierge Level booking), were always different and a meal in itself. Salad, tuna shooters, meatloaf w/ cubed sweet potatoes, soup, grilled chicken and pasta, tortellini w/ lobster sauce, ribs, shrimp creole w/ rice ..... these are just a few of the things we enjoyed during our stay and it changes each night. They also have a dessert bar from 8-10p.m., with 2 or 3 things to choose from. NOTE: The Concierge Lounge closes at noon on Friday and does NOT re-open until 2p.m. on Sunday. If staying over a weekend, you will need to eat breakfast elsewhere. Shula's steakhouse on the ground floor offers a breakfast buffet and menu items. We did not eat at Shula's, as it is VERY expensive. The breakfast buffet is $20 per person. Fitness center and pool: Top-notch and unlike most places we have stayed. Lots of exercise equipment available and the center itself is beautifully decorated. The pool is on the roof of the 7th floor and although not heated (cold even on hot days because of the wind up there), offers a fantastic view. Staff: The bell hops are very friendly, the front-desk staff is nice but very business-like in nature. The cleaning staff were all very friendly and helpful. But the Concierge Lounge staff won our hearts! Taxes: Our bill reflects Sales Tax, Occupancy Tax, Room Tax AND Parking Tax. This easily adds $40 to your bill each day, on top of $35 for parking each day AND $14.95 for internet a day. Throw in the tips and wow, now you may not be able to afford that trip to Bourbon Street after all. It makes sense that this hotel caters to mainly to those traveling on business (and not so much families), as it is my guess that the company is picking up the tab, not the traveler. BUT ... if you can afford it, stay here. you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Love the JW, but the internet connections were spotty”
Reviews.Author: horsewalker4
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, service and location but if you need to do alot of live streaming or downloads you may need to go accross the street to the Marriott New Orleans. Maybe it was just the week we were there but we tried several different locations in the building, thinking we just had a bad room... and had real problems. Went accross the street and no issues. Other than that everything was top notch, just what you expect from a JW.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the JW!”
Reviews.Author: pinkbutterflyteacher
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay here! Beautiful rooms, comfy bedding, clean, fresh, quiet, great service. The view from our room, 2118, overlooked the parade that they were having for the Italian American parade. We didn't know there would be any parades going on during our stay so this was a nice surprise. The breakfast in the concierge lounge was fantastic. Staff was friendly and helpful. Best of all, the location is perfect!!!! We walked back from Harrah's at night and it was just a few blocks. Good times in N'awlins!!! Would love to stay at the JW again and would definitely recommend to any friend.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: MM3939
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this hotel overnight after visiting the WWII Museum. It is very well located on Canal and the motor lobby behind the hotel is convenient. The lobby is attractive. The employees are friendly and helpful. Our room was terrific! I am still thinking of buying a pair of those pillows for my home. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable,but disappointing in the concierge”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie R
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here during the Rock n Roll Marathon. The location was perfect for the start of the race and within walking distance of Bourbon Street and shopping. Our room was 2306... This room was so so. The bathroom was very tiny and with the toilet right in front of the door going in, it was awkward. There wasn't much space between the bed and the tv/bureau stand. Our room was near the elevator so all night we heard the up and down sounds of the elevator of which was quite annoying. The mattress needed some updating also. Before our visit, I received an email from JW Marriott asking if there was anything that they could provide me before our arrival. I asked for specific pillows,of which was part of a selection. I did receive the pillows in my room. I also asked that chocolate covered strawberries and champagne be delivered to my friend's room for an additional $40. I received another email from Isabelle asking me what day I would like it delivered so I emailed her back letting her know what day and time I wanted this delivered. When I checked in at the hotel I made sure that that was all set and the gal said yes. The delivery was never made to my friend's room. I was VERY disappointed especially since Isabelle from concierge told me that she would take care of it. I thought the champagne and strawberries would be a great gift to my friends because they ran their very first 1/2 marathon in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “First class!”
Reviews.Author: Karen E
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one week. Hotel is beautiful, service excellent, Shula's in the hotel is awesome! Stayed on Marriot points and was worth blowing them all on. Neighborhood close to everything. This was back in 2009, I've since moved to New Orleans and have recommended it to everyone. I know the review is awhile back, but I still hear wonderful things, and still love the bar there.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable centralJW Mariott”
Reviews.Author: artnuvo
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in a King , 25th floor, river view=peering between 2 buildings. Room was quiet, quite large, with safe and pay for internet capability, small bathroom, comfortable K bed and well lit. St Charles streetcar for the Garden District is 1 block; french quarter is across the street. Concierge service is excellent. Visiit the national park service jazz history museum at the old mint, decatur st, for free jazz programs, check offbeat magazine and offbaet.,com for music venues; listen to jeremy davenport at the ritz carlton, no cover or min, jazz at the irvin mayfield room at the marriott with no cover, 1 drink min; and jazz/blues venues on frenchmen street -- 3 muses, BMC, DBA, snug harbor' take the nps.gov free walking tour and a private free garden district tour.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay in the big easy!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 6stringer00
Reviews.Content: had a wonderful stay at the jw, a little noisy one night but after a couple of phone calls to the front desk, it was taken care of. stayed on the 24th floor and had a beautiful view of the city at night. Isabella a great concierge and can take care of all your needs. Had breakfast at Shula's and it was pricey for a buffett, and it was just ok. You can walk to anywhere you want to go.

Reviews.Title: “7th year in a row”
Reviews.Author: TottenhamFan
Reviews.Content: I've been to a conference at this hotel for seven consecutive years now, and the place is just rock solid consistent. Great location on the route for several downtown parades, and midway between Bourbon St and the casino. Easy walk to some of the great modern restaurants like August (Besh) and NOLA (Emeril) or the classics like Galatoire's and Antoine's, and anywhere else in the Quarter. Several of the staff have been there as long as I've been staying there, and they all do a great job under the immense pressure of Mardi Gras.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Cratty
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to NOLA. The location is perfect for first timers. Hotel was very clean, comfortable beds, nice robes! The concierge was really helpful and offered us a variety of places to see great music beyond Bourbon. We didn't rent a car and it wasn't necessary. Took the frilly everywhere or walked except to go to Vaughn's Lounge. The airport shuttle was real handy too. Breakfast seemed a little steep. We walked to The Red Slipper for angreat breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “well located, but lacks a cozy feeling”
Reviews.Author: Philippe_DC
Reviews.Content: great location close to Bourbon. 1st time in a JW, and I was not very enthousiastic about the concept, at least not this one. on the positive side rooms are great, had some live music, free wine happy hour (always apppreciated after a long day at a coonvention). Somehow that's all I ask from a hotel, but it left me with a feeling of lack of conviviality. Common areas are very limited, you have to go to Shula to get a meal "in the hotel" (by the way they were great and accomodating for a cheap breakfast). I was surprised when I learnt that JW is at the high end of the Marriott chain. That said, I would be very happy if I "had to" stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Redleg71
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 day trip to New Orleans and stayed at the JW. Like many of you I rely on the reviews from Trip Advisor before making a decision. I must admit, some of the reviews had me a bit concerned, but after 4 days in this hotel I would definately stay there again and recommend it to friends. Lets be honest, anyone can find something to complain about; but in a city known for it's seedy sinful excess the JW was a great retreat to comfort and luxury. The positives were many. 1.)Location. You can't beat it for a large chain hotel. It is located at the corner of St Charles and Canal. This is just about a block and a half from Bourbon Street and The French Quarter. You also have easy access to the St Charles trolley car (Which takes you to the Garden District and the Warehouse District) and the Canal Street Line. There are also plenty of shops directly across the street to buy beer and other items to take up to your room. 2.)Service. Top notch, especially given that many of these employees are assaulted with a never ending stream of drunkards. Despite probably hearing the same dumb comments over and over and over, the staff always remained patient, upbeat, and friendly. This was not my expeirence at other places in the city. Although we arrived early on our flight we were immediately given a room. On one occasion, it had been raining and the front desk provided us umbrellas. On another, I ordered room service late at night and my shrimp Po boy showed up in about 10 minutes, was delicious, and had about 30 gulf shrimp in it!. The kitchen called a few minutes later to see if everything was to my liking. But the best example is when a women was getting arrested in the lobby and the staff apologized to us for the disturbance! 3.)The Room We had a king bed room on the 24th floor. It was immaculate. The bed and linens were extremely nice and it was one of the best night sleeps my wife and I have had in a long time. No problem whatsoever with noise especially consider that the weekend we were there was the start of Mardi Gras. The room was made up every day and new towels were brought in. 4.)Amenities My wife visited the spa and was quite pleased. There is also a Shulas steakhouse which we tried for breakfest. Although Shulas is your typical ubiquitous steakhouse type restaraunt the breakfest we had there was pretty good albeit a bit pricey. If I had to give a few minuses it would be these--and this is being quite nitpicky. No mini-bar in the room Hair Dryer sucked. I needed a pen to write with and housekeeping did not provided that after the last guest left. Others have said this was not up to the typical JW standard. The newer JW's like the one in Indianapolis are over the top. This is an older hotel but compared to the other options available in New Orleans their should be no concern with quality. Bottom Line: Pretty Darn Good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: macked
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, Great Location. We had a high level room facing northeast for a great view of the French Quarter. Helpful staff, One problem was the valet parking. It is somewhere around $30.00 and was a complete mess when we checked out on a Sunday morning around 10am. Beware there is no self park there. However street cars right there and you are in walking distance of most things you would probably want to do! Great hotel, just have to work on that parking problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Larry J
Reviews.Content: My wife was able to use her skills on Priceline to get us into this hotel for less that $100 per night. We found it to be a very lovely hotel. There are many amenities availabe at the hotel for those interested. We had one problem which was rectified by the hotel. Our friends came in late, and the clerk couldn't find the reservation for them. They were told they could hang out until 2:30 AM, or check in and pay $230 for the night. I had to go to my room and find our reservation papers to show him the reservations. He still had trouble, even with the numbers available, until we could show him they were two separate reservations. In his defense, our friends reservation was in our name. But the next morning the desk manager was very apologetic. She comped us our parking for one week while we went on a cruise. Parking is ordinarily about $35 per night. The hotel is on Canal next to the French Quarter, making it central to most activities one might want to use.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: klageman
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this property January 28-31st. In the interest of full disclosure, we paid very little for our trip because we used Marriott points . That being said, we certainly would've paid more to stay here. The location is central to anywhere you could possibly need to go. Our room was very clean, the bed very comfortable and the best part, NO NOISE. We stayed in a corner room on 28th floor and never heard a peep from anyone. The fitness facility is well appointed and all the equipment in good working condition. All the staff we interacted with were friendly and eager to help. And if you happen to stop for a cocktail at Shulas, the hotel restaurant, you'll love having Ian pour you a drink!

Reviews.Title: “Have had better”
Reviews.Author: EdOverIp
Reviews.Content: Really good location. 2 short blocks walk from French Quarter. However, we felt like something was missing the whole time we were there. The feeling that was missing was warmth -- physically and figuratively speaking. Physically: We were upgraded to a corner king (thanks!) which was a nice size room but for some reason, the room never warmed up to a comfortable level no matter what we set the temp to. We never called the front desk because we were never in the room for long so not sure if it's an isolated instance or hotel wide. Figuratively: For a JW, we didn't get that luxury feeling. We have had way better experience at lesser Marriott brands and properties than this JW. The bell staff would ask "Do you need help with your luggage?" upon arrival but we got the feeling that it was out of courtesy not because they wanted to help. While all the staff were very nice, it didn't feel like they cared. I know that's very subjective but that's how we felt. Room cleaning was also very inconsistent. Day 1 we had more towels than we need, Day 2 we barely had enough. It was as if the person just loaded the room with "enough" towels for the entire stay. Very odd. We will not be returning to this hotel. Next time we will probably try the regular Marriott across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Day before a Caribbean Cruise”
Reviews.Author: hdep48
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the day before taking a cruise to the Caribbean. Being it was January we didn't want to get snowed in up north so we decided to visit New Orleans for the first time. Hotel is a 20 minute shuttle ride from the airport - $14.00 p.p. Location is on Canal Street close to food, art galleries, and extreme fun on Bourbon Street. Hotel staff very helpful in the what and where of their city. Beds are great - staff is wonderful. Plenty of food on site or just out the front door. They also accomodated us on our return from the cruise with keeping our lugggage secure while we had some more enjoyable time in the city since our flight took us back up north after 5 p.m.

Reviews.Title: “close to luxury”
Reviews.Author: glendamak
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is in the same building and connected to the Ritz Carlton in New Orleans. Very convenient to the French Quarter but not so close to the hustle & bustle to be distracting. Lovely decor and wonderful service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ben807
Reviews.Content: Stayed at JW Marriott while vacationing in New Orlean. Booked room through priceline so, for what I paid, found it to be an outstanding value. Room was on 26th floor with great view of the Mississippi and downtown. Hotel features fantastic location- adjacent to Fr Quarter without the hassle of being in it. Also great restaurants "downtown" within walking. Clean, nice 4* hotel. Nice room; bathroom a little small but very nice.

Reviews.Title: “good but not great”
Reviews.Author: nocal1
Reviews.Content: nice enough but not great. good location and we always enjoy new orleans. would stay again if the price was better.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Liza9999
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great location on Canal. It's across the street from a Marriott so don't be confused. We got this on Priceline. The room was very good. The front desk and concierge were very accommodating. Although the bathroom is small, the actual shower is large. I had a pedicure in the spa here that was very good. We had breakfast here and it was very good and the only negative was the restaurant service. I never sat down to breakfast in a restaurant without immediate coffee and water being served, and we had to seek out a waitress a few times during the meal. I

Reviews.Title: “decent but hey its new orleans”
Reviews.Author: H0ust0n_Texas
Reviews.Content: Not a good JW, bout like just a regular Marriott, Slightly dirty and old, club level was just ok, no free alcohol, food was decent but not great, nice walking distance to french qtr and cable cars,

Reviews.Title: “great hotel near French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: PtboCan
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms for a one night stay before a cruise. After initial mixup on the price of the second room being incorrect, the error was fixed immediately. They found us two corner rooms right next to each other so we could visit easily and sit in one room and still hear the one year old cry if she happened to wake up before we were ready to sleep. The roomswere very clean, modern and had fine quality linens. The french quarter is a quick walk but far enough away so as not to be in the middle of the noise and commotion. Staff was all vey friendly. I highly reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great expectations”
Reviews.Author: LUCKY J
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location but the customer service is poor. On our arrival date we had reservations at Shulas steakhouse ( located in the hotel ) unable to find a hostess to seat us after 20 minutes of standing around we left. One day asked the front desk to have our room cleaned while we want on a tour, when we returned ( 3 hours later the room still had not been cleaned ). Went to Shulas on our depature date ( should of known better ) for the breakfast buffet, we had to practically seat our selves and had to enter the kitchen to request coffee and juice at the end of our breakfast had to enter the kitchen again to request our bill. When we finally checked out at the front desk our bill was overcharged by $ 500 , had to wait 20 minutes to straighten out. We are marriott reward members.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: michiganpamela
Reviews.Content: We made a very last minute trip to come down to the Saints game. Our usual hotel was booked. We looked on Travelocity and found this hotel. We weren't really sure about it and had not remembered seeing it during one of our many trips down. Being as it was almost the only hotel room left in the city we booked it. Upon our arrival we were greeted by a very friendly desk clerk. Our room was wonderful. Very clean. It looks newly refurbished. It was quiet, a bonus on busy Canal Street. When we checked out they were just as friendly. The bellhops were so enthusiastic as we headed out to the game. Even the woman cleaning, who is a 49ers fan, chatted with us. The price was exceptional given our huge corner room and competitive rates. We will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: aa6nz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five days on Marriott Points as a platinum member with access to the executive lounge in room 1922. We were greeted professionally and friendly at the check in and check out. The bellmen there especially 'William" were so friendly and professional when we left I felt like he was an old friend. He gave recomendations on resturants, drinking spots, cigar bars , etc.He is a great asset to the hotel.This hotel has the best gym, with new equipment, clean towels, great water and layout. We ate out and drank every day and night anything and everything we wanted but because of the Gym, I gained no weight in 5 days! We ran into some of the Asst coaches of the Carolina Pathers in the gym, who were staying there. As a matter of fact I played against this coach back in the 1970's while playing for the SC Carolina Gamecocks he was coaching at UNC at that time. He had a better memory than me! I looked for Cam Newton but didnt see him. The location of the hotel was perfect right on Canal Street right across from Royal street in the French Quarter. That was perfect... we felt safe, secure and rested as we could walk everywhere in the FQ. As a matter of fact we were so spoiled we had a reservation at a restaurant not in the FQ, but cancelled because of so many places we could eat in the Quarter and didnt want to take a cab. The hotel is clean, modern and safe and in a perfect location. We will stay here again! Great Stay!

Reviews.Title: “Over rated hotel”
Reviews.Author: kkjohnson521
Reviews.Content: Pros: Excellent location, great bellman and parking staff... Cons: Employees other than the bellman/parking staff not hospitable. Certainly not what I would consider 4-5 star service. So many good choices in New Orleans...probably would not choose this one again...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location! Slight mixup with reservations...”
Reviews.Author: mjh84
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was as close to perfect as it comes. I got a room with 2 double beds and they were comfortable. I'll agree with a few other reviews saying the bathroom was 'small', but it wasn't cramped. What you are really getting with this hotel is location. Just 2 blocks from Bourbon, and surrounded by restaurants (both high class and fast food) a Walgreens and CVS, multiple beer/liquor stores. I preferred staying off Bourbon because you don't get effected by the noise, and are still within 15 mins walking distance of anything in the French Quarter. The one problem I had with the hotel was when the declined my reservation on the 27th, 2 days before I flew down from New York. I was told in August, when I booked the trip, I wouldn't be charged until I got there (ended up getting charged upon checkout). I was told they tried to bill my card on the 27th...but between August and the end of December I had a fraudulent change on my card and changed my #. I had to call them and spend about an hour to get my room back...who knows what would have happened if they booked my room. I give them credit for getting my room back, but like I said, I don't want to know if it had gone differently.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a JW branded hotel”
Reviews.Author: GlobalCitizen86
Reviews.Content: First off, I am typing this review on using the internet from my MiFi because the internet connection here is so bad I can't even check my email most of the time. Thats pretty unacceptable to me in this day and age, I don't care if its free if I can't use it. The staff at times has also been a little curt and rude, although some people have been very nice. The concierge lounge is a mixed bag, good food in the evening but they only serve breakfast for an hour and then promptly take everything away. One lady up there didnt even want to see if she had anymore english muffins because they had run out with 15 minutes left of service. gross, its your job to keep things stocked, i dont know what her problem was. THey also kept running out of drinks (soda, water, coffee, etc) The food at night had seafood and was ok, small selection and again, they kept running out of things and taking their time to restock them. on the plus side, they did a great job cleaning our room and everything looks nice and new. I also had a nice view of the river and FQ. overall i was just disappointed, if i come back again i would definitely choose the Pere Marquette down the street over this place. i've stayed there before and its definitely the better place to use my reward points.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...quiet and family friendly!”
Reviews.Author: mbin8910
Reviews.Content: While not as elegant as other JW's, it has a great location on Canal Street within easy walking distance of Jackson Square. Coffee and dining facilities are wean, but the concierge lounge was great, when open. Rooms are clean and well equipped.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break, NOLA”
Reviews.Author: CP6785
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my 2nd visit to the Crescent City and loved it. This hotel is in the perfect location to downtown NOLA. The rooms are awesome (we got complimentary strawberries and champagne sent up) they are clean and comfortable. The Marriott is a short walk to Harrah's Casino and Bourbon Street-where the party never stops. Bourbon street is great, but can get expensive. It's definitely the place to be at any time of day. My boyfriend and I loved the live music, walking around with drinks and enjoying the sights, but there are plenty of other things to do in the city too. First off, do not pass up a chance to take a swamp tour. We went with Captain Rodney and he was phenomenal. We saw tons of gators and he was an excellent tour guide. Riding the street car is definitely the way to get around. Take it to the French Market where you can eat outside, and listen to live Jazz. Very romantic. There is also great street artists in front of the cathedral there where you can pick up some local artwork, and an awesome flea market too. You can take the street car out to Magazine Street to see some of the old garden homes, bars, and great restaurants. Tracy's on Magazine street has the best Roast Beef po boy I've ever had! Another hidden gem in NOLA is Frenchman Street. There are tons of bars/music clubs on this street and it's much much cheaper/less crowded than Bourbon. We loved going out there. If you get the opportunity, rent bikes and ride around the city, it's the perfect way to enjoy all the architecture and stop off for food and beers whenever you want. Try to stay away from chain resturants and get the local flavor of the city. It's a great place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Expected Better”
Reviews.Author: TMichael2
Reviews.Content: We just spent three nights at the JW Marriott in New Orleans. On the positive side, the hotel is well-located in downtown New Orleans, providing easy access to the French Quarter, restaurants, art galleries, etc. And, the members of the hotel staff are very friendly. But, I was disappointed with the size of the room, the furnishings, the size/condition of the bathroom, the lack of WiFi availability, the low quality towels and linens, and the lack of any sound-proofing (we heard everything going on outside from the 14th floor and we heard the elevators zipping up and down inside the hotel all night). There was also no way to effectively regulate the temperature of the room. At best, this is a three-star hotel, which is fine if that is what you are looking (and paying) for.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in an Awesome City”
Reviews.Author: Megan R
Reviews.Content: This one of the nicest marriot's I have stayed in. I would definitely recommend for business or family vacation when visiting New Orleans. Make sure you figure out parking, you have to valet your car and its a little confusing where to go. You have to drive down a side street in the back- watch out for one way streets!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort in the Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: pdclarry
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week in New Orleans, staying at the JW Marriott (not to be confused with the Marriott New Orleans across the street, which our taxi driver did). This is an exceptionally comfortable hotel in an ideal location, as the intersection of 3 street car lines and on the edge of the French Quarter, a 2 minute walk to Bourbon Street. The staff went out of their way to be friendly and helpful; not just the standard hotel clerk smile, but they gave the impression of really caring. The bed was excellent, the amenities good quality, the Concierge Lounge comfortable and with real breakfast and good enough evening collation to replace dinner (but who would do that in New Orleans, the restaurant capital of the USA)? Particular likes: Didn't nickel and dime us. The bottled water in the room was free, as was the coffee and tea. No minibar, but did include a fridge (empty). Even the guest laundry machines were free! Great view from our corner room. Better than average gym. Very helpful concierge, got us last minute Christmas dinner reservations at a superb restaurant. Both the room and the public areas were immaculately clean. Plenty of hangers in the closet, plenty of drawers for clothes. 2 LED reading lights on the bed. Dislikes: Parking was $35 a day. Concierge Lounge closed on weekends. Condensation on the window sills, pretty consistently. 2 maintenance problems took multiple calls to resolve, and one was never resolved (slow bathtub drain). Internet is $15 a day (fortunately, we had our own Internet via a Verizon MiFi). It DOES include free domestic telephone, but who uses a hotel telephone anymore?

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: universeenergy
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the ritz the first night, that place was old and musty. rooms are ot up to par. however i moved to jw marriott and we loved it. yes the bathrooms are kind of small, but some rest rooms are big. just ask the front desk when you are checking in. these rooms are in good condition, clean and average size. king rooms had fridges in it. it has a coffee maker and condiments, ritz had nothing. they give you 2 bottles of complimentary water daily. gresat location, great service. dont eat at shulas food sucked, zero seasoning. it may have been a bad day.. but the twice baked potatoe,. crab mac cheese, gumbo, salad, crab cakes all sucked.

Reviews.Title: “Damp,Old Beds,Dirty Carpets, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: AARDVARKKILLER
Reviews.Content: We checked into the JW Marriott Just before Christmas and Stayed for 4 Nights. The Staff is Great, A great staff doesn't make a great hotel. The room was so damp that we couldn't see out the windows, there was moisture inside, and near the windows, that aren't made to open it was cold and DRAFTY. When we wiped them off we could see that most of the windows on our side of the hotel were just like ours. Our bed was old, and lumpy, and try wearing white socks in the room, dirty in one pass of the very small room. I am an Elite member of SPG, No open Club.Granted it was Christmas weekend, so I will give them that, but no offer to offset the closure.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ThomasFromBelgium
Reviews.Content: JW Marriott is located on Canal Street, nearby the ferry and close to the French Quarter. Hotel is clean and luxuary. Free wifi in lobby, wired internet ($ 15/day) in the rooms. Friendly staff, helpfull concierge. Rooms are spacious (we had an upgrade to rooms in the corners of the building), well equiped and housekeeping is doing a great job. Nice view over the Mississipi river. Breakfast buffet ($ 20) is OK but not wow. They ran out of plain yoghourt nearly every day. Hotel bar is cozy but not many drinks available. They can do better. Pool is outside on the roof. Nice when it's warm but useless during our stay. Water is "warmed" while other hotels have "heated" outdoor pools, just 2 blocks away. Lunch in their steakhouse is rather expensive and steak is not what we expected. Eat elsewhere !

Reviews.Title: “not really a JW”
Reviews.Author: josh m
Reviews.Content: the hotel use to be a meredian I believe beofre marriott bought this property. It is a very nice hotel but doesnt quite measure up to the JW name. Good location, service is good but not great especially for a JW. Rooms were okay but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DK_FLOrlando
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, wasn't as nice as I would have hoped especially for 215.00 a night!

Reviews.Title: “No Wifi, no room cleaning, old beds”
Reviews.Author: chinchoman
Reviews.Content: You would think that a JW Marriott would have the option of WIFI in the room, even at a cost? This one only has wired internet which we were told was very slow (we couldn't use it as we took ipads). We left the room at about 11:30 every morning and only once was the room made out of the 4 nights! The other times we had to complain at the front desk. Beds are probably 10 years old or more too. Location is great, though.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: EcoFoodie
Reviews.Content: Came in late October to celebrate my best friend's birthday. The gentleman who checked us in was wonderful. He wished my friend a happy birthday and asked if we had ever been to New Orleans. It was a first time for both of us, so he took the time to provide a map, explain what areas were safe for two single women, recommend restaurants, etc. The room was comfortable, however the linens showed clear wear and tear with a few holes in the sheets. The style of the hotel (corridors especially) was loud, but it worked for the city. Housekeeping service was excellent, and the amenities were great. The prices seemed a bit expensive at first, but upon closer observation they are competitive with other local hotels. I'd definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME hotel! Beautiful and quiet rooms”
Reviews.Author: Memberrs
Reviews.Content: This hotel lives up to the reputation of JW Marriot hotels worldwide. The service is impecable and the rooms are huge and nearly soundproof! The beds are super comfortable and the bathrooms are giant. Overall a great hotel. Pricey but worth it. The location is excellent for touring around New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Marriott for sure, but not sure if it deserves the JW”
Reviews.Author: DCvagabond1
Reviews.Content: This is a nice enough hotel - comfortable room, nice linens. But it seems more like a regular Marriott than a JW Marriott. Small lobby, dated decor, small bathroom. Pleasant, nice, good location - but not top-of-the-line luxury that the name would indicate.

Reviews.Title: “Wednesday nights is Get in NOLA, meet local artist”
Reviews.Author: persephone57
Reviews.Content: If you are in New Orleans on every Wednesday night there is live music and a local artist exhibit. Come enjoy, meet the artis and their work.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but, The Beds ???”
Reviews.Author: bythesea857
Reviews.Content: I just don't get that a hotel like this would have double beds. You would think they would have queen beds in the rooms. I did call for a roll away bed so that I could have a nights sleep because the double just wasn't working for my husband and I. They did deliver it quickly. Also the bathroom was a bit small, one person at a time. Other then that everyone was very friendly. Shula's, the restaurant in the hotel was excellent !

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, typical Marriott”
Reviews.Author: kaykayram
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with my sister for one night before we left on a cruise out of New Orleans. Room was ready upon check-in, service was quick and good, and the room was a typical Marriott room. The location is convenient to walk to the french quarter and the riverwalk area. I prefer some of the historic hotels in New Orleans where you get more of the local "flavor" over this hotel, but this is a personal preference and I can't fault this hotel for being a typical Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Echoman62
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice Hotel, of course it is a Five Star, it leaves you close to the French Quarter but just far enough away that you can't hear the revelrie at night. Very courteous staff from the house keeping personell all the way to the front desk people. I did have one problem with the shower head in the room, but it was replaced by the time I finished breakfast and the staff was very apologetic and offered compensation for the inconvenience. Great stay in a great city!

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything. Good with children.”
Reviews.Author: cog480
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our children (ages 3 and 5) for a family reunion this weekend. Our room was clean. I was impressed with how friendly the staff was (although, it is La., and people there ARE friendly.) For example, we got the breakfast buffet and they didn't charge us for them. Also, since they park the cars on site, it was always very quick to get them from the valet. Many hotels in NOLA park offsite, and you end up waiting 30 minutes for your vehicle. it was walking distance to the quarter, the shops on Canal, and to the St. Charles streetcar. If we weren't leaving the city for family reunions, we would have not needed a car.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: peter a a
Reviews.Content: 2 night stay room 2304 Nov 13/14 , felt very itchy after first night , next day after 2nd night welts started showing up in little groups of 3 , so far hotel has not got back to me. Room 2304

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beth J
Reviews.Content: We had a late arrival on a Saturday night and were told that there was a water problem so we would be moved to a sister hotel. The front desk staff were very polite and helpful. The doorman was arranging for a taxi as we were speaking to the front desk staff. After less than 5 minutes, they did find us a room so we did not have to move. The room was quiet, clean and a good size. The location was perfect - so close to the French Quarter. We were able to leave our bags at the hotel and wander around before we had to leave for our cruise. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter Proximity without the chaos”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMom30
Reviews.Content: The Marriott is a great location for those looking to explore the French Quarter but the escape the hustle and bustle when it's time to rest. The hotel sits directly on canal street and it's an easy block to the trolley and across the street from the Quarter. The staff is friendly and the rooms were large and well maintained. I found the bed to be quite comfortable--but that's possibly because was usually around 2am when I crawled into it. :)The views from the top floors were fantastic (I was on 29), you could see all over NOLA. I stayed partially with points and paid the rest. The rate was very reasonable for a great location and a nicely appointed hotel. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Gornie
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent full-service hotel, with a great staff, including a concierge who was very helpful with tourist information, directions, etc. Rooms are good size, and somewhat usually shaped. Our room had a wall separating the sink and bathroom from the bedroom area. Room was very quiet, although we overlooked Canal Street and the French Quarter. Hotel is well located for sightseeing in the French Quarter, as Canal Street forms a boundary for it. Hotel offers a free laundry, next to the health club, so one can throw a load in the washing machine, work out, then throw the clothes in the dryer.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: West Palm Beach, Florida, United States
Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with spot on service”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a destination bachelorette party so we took up several rooms. Had a fantastic rate and were treated like very special guests. One in our party was physically disabled and was well accommodated - the rest of us were very comfortable in our rooms as well with cozy beds, pillows, and lots of necessary towels. Concierge often approached us to make sure we were making the most of our stay, which was greatly appreciated. Thanks JW Marriott! We'll be back! :)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed and not up to expectations!”
Reviews.Author: ews414
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW Marriott for 3 nights in early November (11/5-11/8). The expereince was disapointing from the start. The check-in process was very slow and there were no apologies given. The front desk staff bordered on being rude, at the very least they were unattentive and disinterested. The king room was small and the bathroom smaller. The staff was not particularly helpful nor friendly. There were room service items left in the hallway for 2 days and no one picked them up. Two of the four elevators were apparently out of service for most of the first 2 days resulting in long lines to We are loyal Marriott travlers and have stayed in JW's before, but this hotel was not up to the standards of the brand at all. We had a good time in New Orleans despite the above, but I would not stay here again. We were willing to pay for luxury......this was not it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Nice size rooms; Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Richard Y
Reviews.Content: Worth the visit. However needs more employees at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: souriz
Reviews.Content: Luckily this was a business trip and I did not have to fork over the $400/night for an ok room. I've paid $140 for similar rooms in other hotels. The rate was expensive due to a local football game that night and all hotels in New O jacked up their rates accordingly. As well, being a business trip, it was a real bummer that we had no WiFi in the rooms - there were, however, 2 courtesy PC's in the lobby (stand-up stations). Service was courteous and the rooms were large and clean but just not worth that rate. Had it been $140/night, I would have given them a 4/5. Nice buffet breakfast with hot/cold options.

Reviews.Title: “4 star luxury at a great location.”
Reviews.Author: senior_traveller60
Reviews.Content: Great location for all tourtistic activity. Good for public transport. This is more upmarket, then the normal Marriott chain. Had a great view of the Mississippi from the room, even though this is not the tallest building in the vicinity. The in house steak house is one of the best in the US. There was music available almost everyday in the music lounge. Very helpul and friendly staff. But then it is a a very friendly city. It is one of the foodie capitals of the World !

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, very good room, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: view2mtn
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews before staying here so my expectations were fairly low. I got a very good price on the room as part of a trade show at the convention center. I've never stayed at another JW Marriott but I've stayed in hundreds of other hotels of all levels and this place is actually fine. I'll give you the good and the bad. The good: excellent staff - my first room had a noisy ceiling exhaust fan that I knew instantly would bother me so I just hauled my belongings back to the front desk and they happily gave me another room which they also said was an upgrade. The room was really nice, I loved the layout and it was very, very quiet. Twice I asked the concierge for a restaurant recommendation and both restaurants were fabulous (Bonton - ask for Pat's section and Pelican Club - for a very nice dinner). I also like the free guest laundry. You NEVER see this in an upscale hotel, I did my own laundry and this made the trip for me. The gym was also quite nice. They also don't try to nickel and dime you like some upscale hotels. And the location couldn't be better. You are literally steps away from just about anything. The bad - truthfully, I didn't have any complaints. I don't think the room is worth $300 or more a night and my colleague, who has stayed at other JW Marriotts, said that this really isn't up to that grade but I found it perfectly fine. The TV had some serious issues but I spoke to the front desk and they said it was a temporary problem. I can believe that, I've stayed in many, many hotels and this is a very common problem (i don't know why though, millions of Americans have no trouble getting cable to come in clearly, why do hotels struggle so much with this?). There is so much to do in New Orleans that you really shouldn't be spending much time in front of the tv anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at New Orleans JW”
Reviews.Author: cra1068
Reviews.Content: In town for vacation and got a great rate here. Second time staying here. Location is perfect, close to everything, yet not loud like some places in the quarter. A really nice perk is the new I-club music venue that is located right off the lobby. A great place to see live music right in the hotel and no cover for hotel guests. Drinks a little pricey, but we saw a couple great bands including the owner of the club, Irvin Mayfield. Room was nice as was the bed and service was fine. When in New Orleans, this is becoming our homebase.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Comfortable; Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Debora_9
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasant stay at this hotel. The panoramic view of the city from my corner room was truly breathtaking, I enjoyed the extra touches, like the tea and Biscoff cookies, the magazines and the reading light on the headboard. The staff was indeed very friendly as noted in other reviews. I make it a habit to tip the hotel maids, but never before have I received a handwritten "Thank You" note in return. Additionally, the breakfast buffet at Shula's was very tasty and a good value. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Kempka
Reviews.Content: From start to finish this was an excellent hotel. Great views and excellent location. The staff especially the bell staff were incredible. Thanks so much.

Reviews.Title: “new orleans 2011”
Reviews.Author: Ruth53924
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott is a great location, two blocks or so from the French Quarter, Riverwalk and the French Market is a bit further away. The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful. We ate at Shula's one evening for a change from the southern creole food. We were able to order just an appetizer and dessert and the staff was most accommodating. The rooms were nicely laid out and the beds most comfortable. We had a problem with the water in the bathroom, only could get hot water. They sent someone up immediately and it was take care of. The door to the bathroom almost hit the sink, they needed to do a better planning on the design. Their continental breakfast is a good value for $14.95, selection of cereals, bagels, juices, fruit, danish and selected items. You will not go hungry. We bought vouchers for transportation from the airport and return for $40 each way. You can get a cab to the JW from the airport for $33 for two people and you do not have to wait around for people to fill up the bus and to be delivered to other hotels. Ruth Washington Crossing

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Concierge Lounge hors d' oeuvres”
Reviews.Author: jefinsd
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Marriotts all over the U.S. The quality of the evening hors d' oeuvres at JW New Orleans was superb. Typical fare at most locations is greasy, salty happy hour bar food. This location provided such superb quality entrees, and I do mean entree that they would rival any quality restaurant. Every day was a new epicurean adventure. Our lounge staff was excellent. The hotel itself is smaller than the large Marriott convetion hotel across the street and provides a more intimate atmosphere. The front door bellman was very friendly and helpful to all. The rooms have been remodeled with granite counters placed over the existing furniture, making for a slightly updated look. The beds are comfortable with individual reading lights on the headboards. On the greener side, the toilets have been replaced with 1.6gpf low flow models.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, great location”
Reviews.Author: melbyed
Reviews.Content: I am also puzzled by the negative reviews of this wonderful hotel. My wife and I just got back from an anniversary trip to New Orleans, and were dazzled by the JW Marriott. From the doorman to check-in to concierge to waitstaff and housekeeping, the service was simply impeccable. On top of that, the staff seemed to truly enjoy what they were doing - smiles and jokes all around made the trip even more fun. Add to that a great location (two blocks to Bourbon street, walking distance to the Riverwalk and French Market), great food and drinks, beautiful and spacious rooms, terrific lobby....well, not much more to say. Highly, highly, recommended - I literally cannot think of a single negative thing to say about this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the JW!”
Reviews.Author: kstvlagnt
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from the JW Marriott in New Orleans. The staff was all very nice and extremely helpful. The Canal Streetcars were literally across the street, so getting around was very easy and economical. The St. Charles Streetcar was just around the corner. It's on the outskirt of the French Quarter, which for us, was perfect. Just across the street was Bourbon and Royal. So, it was close enough to get in on all the fun, yet far enough away from it that we could sleep in a quiet location. The rooms were a decent size, very clean and very comfortable. We didn't spend much time there, but, were very happy with the accomodations. I'd definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: K13
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed here for 3 nights for a conference and I joined him for two additional nights to celebrate our anniversary. We had a spacious corner room which was recently updated: nice linens, large flat screen TV, very thick bathrobes and towels. The location was excellent being one block from the French Quarter and one block to the street car to the Garden District. It is the staff which makes this hotel something more than your typical Marriott. The doorman Albert was exceptionally friendly and helpful. He greeeted us by name whenever he saw us. Isabelle the concierge not only secured a hard to come by reservation for us, but sent champagne and chocolate covered strawberries to our room for our anniversary. Our stay here was made memorable due to their efforts.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, clean, great location and value!”
Reviews.Author: msspungen
Reviews.Content: I'm puzzled by the negative reviews because I stayed here from Oct 5th-9th and had a wonderful experience. I was on the 19th floor and it was quiet. The room was clean, spacious, and the bed was super comfortable. The staff was pleasant at all times and very welcoming. There is nothing negative to be said about the hotel itself or the rooms. The location is on Canal St, within walking distance to the major French Quarter locations, Bourbon St, and the streetcar lines. I liked the free WiFi in the lobby and there were 2 computers guests could use (in the lobby) to check email or print airline boarding passes (free). They also gave out free newspapers at the front desk along with free apples. I would recommend avoiding the gift shop as it is small and has basically nothing (except candy and clothes) for sale. There are other shops for food and soda right on Canal St. Also, the hotel restuarant (Shula's) had a rather pitiful breakfast buffet with poor service. Instead of eating here, go across the street, as there are tons of restaurants open 24 hours. Aside from the food and gift shop, everything else was FLAWLESS. Do not hesitate to stay here. I am a VERY PICKY customer and I loved it!!!!! A great location and a clean, comfy room.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Style, Comfort, and Price”
Reviews.Author: syntax73
Reviews.Content: We had come to New Orleans to take a cruise out of the port. My wife had never been so we decided to take a few days to enjoy the city before the cruise. I booked the JW Marriott through a name your own price website for $70 a night in September. Having stayed at other JW locations I thought it was a really great deal. The only downside to the price I would say is the parking fee. At $35 a nigh I felt that was very steep, especially for New Orleans. It is a beautiful hotel though and located very close to the Street Car Line, Bourbon Street, Jackson Square, and the French Market. The Garden District is a short and fun ride on a street car which can be picked up on St Charles Street just around the corner from the hotel. The rooms are very nice and the bed was perfect. The only downside was you could hear the elevator going up and down even with our door shut. It didnt interfere with sleep but the staff should look into it. There is a pool and the gym is well equipped but lacks a good ab machine. We didnt eat at the restaurant but we heard it was very good. The staff is very friendly and very good about making you feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: pjgibn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW Marriott for four nights in Sept 2011. The location on Canal St is great - right on the St Charles streetcar line and directly across from the French Quarter. We were able to walk or ride the streetcars to everything we wanted to do. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful in giving us recommendations for and directions to places to eat and things to do. The hotel lobby is beautiful, but the standard room is not as impressive. It was very clean and the beds were comfortable...but the bathroom was the smallest I have ever seen in a hotel room, including a budget hotel. The bathroom door barely clears the front of the toilet before hitting the tub on the immediate left, while the sink is stuck in the righthand corner. Not a Marriot bathroom by any standards. Also, if your room is close to the elevators, you will hear them hum all night long. Overall, we were satisfied with the accomodations. The great customer service almost made up for the tiny bathroom. We would probably stay at JWMarriott again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “The good and not-so-good”
Reviews.Author: hildegard2011
Reviews.Content: Overall I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The room was clean and spacious with a lovely view of sunrise over the Mississippi. The location was great and there are countless good eating places nearby. But look at the menu before stepping foot into Shulla's, the restuarant in the hotel. It's pretty expensive. I was at a conference here and the hotel food was excellent too. The staff was friendly and hospitable but overall it didn't seem as if one department knew what the other was doing. I think the management needs to work on more synergy among departments. Before I arrived and when I checked in, I inquired about the $15.00 daily internet fee. I asked if it had been waived for our conference and the person at the desk said no. Three days later, after using a tether on my blackberry to get online, we learned that, indeed, the internet fee had been waived. My first day here a housekeeper came into my room before I could get to the door saying she wanted to count the towels. It was a bit unnerving to have someone just unlock the door and walk in. There were directions in the room about how to use the features on the phone but none of them seemed to apply to the actual phone in the room. Not even a staff person was able to figure out how to retrieve a message. He had to call the desk. Then there was the TV. It seemed we were here during the hotel's transition to HDTV. I arrived in my room one afternoon to find the TV turned to high volume and no remote to turn it off. My luggage had been moved as were other items. I thought I was in the wrong room. The woman at the desk told me the housekeeper always leaves the TV on after cleaning!!! Has anyone ever heard of that? I eventually found the remote hidden behind the coffee container. It didn't work. A very nice man came and dismantled the TV so I didn't have to listen to the loud music and ads. After about 2 hours an engineer came and fixed it. The nice man offered to have champaign sent to my room. I opted for a glass of wine. When I say it's a really good hotel, I have to add that in the end the manager comped me for one of the nights of my stay as a result of these relatively small but incremental inconveniences.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: MLK2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel 9/16 - 9/18 and would definitely stay there again. We arrived before noon and our room was ready with all the preferences we had requested when we booked. The hotel and room was modern and clean and definitely a four star hotel. The location on Canal Street was perfect. It was a couple of block walk in one direction to Bourbon Street. The street car stop was also just two blocks away. Harrah's was an easy walk in the opposite direction. Breakfast was included in our rate and it was a buffet at Shula's steakhouse which is part of the property in the lobby. The only negative which others had mentioned is that it cost $35.00 plus tax to park a car.

Reviews.Title: “Not your standard JW Marriott but Good Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: eyehearttravel
Reviews.Content: We specifically booked a king room but when we arrived only rooms with two double beds were left. My husband is quite tall and could barely fit on the bed. They promised to get us a king the next day. This room was alright, carpet felt sticky and the tub was dirty. But the front desk seemed very sorry about the lack of our preferred king room and gave us a 50 dollar gift certificate for breakfast. The next day we were moved to a corner king which was much more spacious and slightly cleaner, though overall not up to normal JW Marriott standards. This is an average hotel with great staff and good prices for the location, just don't expect the luxury that usually accompanies the brand.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: BagbosRichmond_VA
Reviews.Content: Just got back from New Orleans this past weekend (9/16 - 9/18) with some friends and we all stayed at the JW. Hotel is located in a GREAT location. Right at Canal St. and Royal. Royal St. is one of our favorite streets in New Orleans as it has most of our favorite restaurants. Bourbon St is a 5 minute walk which is perfect. You can pick up a trolley within 100 yards. We've stayed on Bourbon St before (Royal Sonesta) and while it was great to be in the "thick" of things, it's also nice to get away from it when it's time to get some sleep. The rooms at the JW are larger than those at the Royal Sonesta as well. Everything you will ever need is 1 block from the JW. Drug Store, Beer, wine, liquor, etc. It's all there. Even a coffee shop just outside and to the right of the JW. It's basically connected. Rooms are standard JW rooms. Comfy beds, great views (we were on the 28th floor out of 30) and we could see the river and the city. It was really nice. There is a bar downstairs at the JW but it's small and we found the service to be sub par there. Just one bartender who wasn't in much of a hurry to do anything. Not to fear, you're in New Orleans! lol. There is a Shula's Steakhouse attached to the hotel and the bar there is nice with great service and selection. We stayed at the JW for $139 / night and I'm a platinum member so got a great upgrade. Marriott is always good at taking care of Platinum Elite members so I do enjoy those perks. The staff is superb from top to bottom. If you have stayed at JW Marriott properties before, you will not be disappointed. I would recommend the JW for families, couples, and those that like to get (just a bit) away from the craziness that Bourbon St can provide. I would stay there again in a heartbeat. Loved the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: magellan74
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the JW Marriott this past Labor Day weekend. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the rooms were clean and comfy. The rates were very reasonable as well. The location is right on Canal Street, so you're right within walking distance to the French Quarter. I felt pretty safe walking between there and the quarter just about any time of night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, personal service! Loved it and will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Cindi K
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time at this hotel! The staff addressed my husband and I by name, were friendly, helpful and considerate, and made us feel like we were at home, and so very welcome. It was also very clean, and right in the middle of all the excitement. You can walk to everything! So convenient! I will be sure to stay here the next time I'm in New Orleans! I would definitely recommend this.

Reviews.Title: “good location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: miatraveling
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff, comfortable beds, quiet hotel in the heart of New Orleans. Coffee shop right next door. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BryanDC
Reviews.Content: We had a really great time staying at the JW Marriott, and got a great last minute rate. The hotel was able to get us a corner room looking toward the French Quarter which was much appreciated. Overall great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: zazuHicksville
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a saturday morning at 11am and our room was ready. It was busy as it was the Red Dress Run. Room was so nice and comfortable, bed was excellent great pillows. Bathroom was great and even had robes :o) We were right by the fun streets and walked all over. Also only 2 blocks from Harrahs. We did take a look at fitness room and pool- it looked great. The hotel bar was nice and the one in front of the restaurant - which is Don Shulers. They have a concierge in the lobby to make dining reservations etc. very helpful. Staff were very pleasant and helpful.Two computers in lobby, where we printed our boarding passes for the return. Overall an excellent place to stay and hope to visit again real soon!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms and good location”
Reviews.Author: andcil_11
Reviews.Content: Rooms are nice and up to date but do not have mini bar. High ceiling and light collies make the room feel large too. Hotel pool was average but that's about all we disliked. Close enough to all of the local attractions

Reviews.Title: “Nice, not sure it met JW standards though”
Reviews.Author: PresLibraryFamily
Reviews.Content: JW is a nicer part of the Marriott family. This hotel doesn't quite cut the regular JW standards though. We arrived late and the parking situation was not clear. The front of the hotel is not the location of the valet, rather the back is. There should be an indication to the effect out front. We checked in and the bathroom was dirty. Toilet had not been flushed and bath tub was not clean. To the credit of the staff they quickly moved us to another floor, even at nearly 1 AM. The hotel is in an excellent location. Easy 5 minute walk to the "French Quarter" - maybe even 3 minutes because we had our children with us.
