The restaurants are nice (expensive), but the parking (mandatory valet) was both expensive and a bit slow. I would stay there again, particularly if I got a good deal, but it is not the high JW Marriott standards we are used to.

Reviews.Title: “Completely average, look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: DeterminedExplorer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are Marriott junkies, but had never stayed at a JW. So when we went to NOLA to visit friends, we decided to stay at the JW instead of a Renaissance. We were disappointed. Sure the JW has all the things and upscale hotel is supposed to have: room service, valet, bellman, spa, world class restaurant, etc. However, everything was lacking much to be desired. Five times we had our car brought around during our trip. All five times we called down 15 minutes ahead of time. All five times we were left to wait in the sweltering heat for our vehicle. Room service was timely but lackluster. The rooms were attractive, but small, and the beds were not standard Marriott quality. The staff were nice but ineffectual. A young couple had a knock down drag out in the room next to us at 4 AM and despite repeated calls, security never addressed the problem. Best part of the trip: Shula's Steakhouse downstairs. It really is fantastic. Worst part: valet. Its an average hotel. Not bad, not good. Stay here if you like, but don't have high expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: cnote1500
Reviews.Content: In my opinion this hotel is kind of sterile. The lobby area is tiny, which is fine...I don't hang out in the lobby much, but a large lobby would feel more inviting. The rooms are nice, if not on the small side. The bathroom was pretty small. The bed are comfortable and the work area is adequate. Overall I'd rather stay at a Renaissance than this hotel. Room service was a miss as well.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in a good location for the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: JenPA2008
Reviews.Content: I was expecting a little more since it is a JW Marriott but it is a nice hotel. The rooms are a little small but we had 3 in our room and made out ok. The staff were all great. Very nice and helpfull. The room was clean and that's the most important thing to me. The resturant in the hotel had a very good breakfast buffet but it is expensive. That is the only meal we had there. I wouldn't pay full price to stay there but if I got a good deal I would definatly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: kweaver22
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott in New Orleans was much nicer than I expected. I had a corner room and it was quite large. The service was wonderful and the hotel is only a short cab (or nice walk) away from Bourbon street and the center of town. The JW is a good choice for a nice hotel particularly for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, beautiful hotel, but they charge for internet”
Reviews.Author: ZuzuTraveler
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the JW. The staff is courteous and the hotel is lovely. But, they charge $15 for internet, and for the price of the hotel, and its attempt to cater to businesspeople, that is unacceptable. The location of the hotel is great, situated right near Decatur and Bourbon streets. I asked for a high room, but did not get one. However, my room was large, very comfortable, and very beautiful. I am not sure when it was remodeled or built, but everything was new and in wonderful condition. This was on the of the nicest rooms I've ever stayed in. I slept very well, and did not hear an upstairs, downstairs, or next door neighbor while I was in my room. Unlike the elevators across the street at the New Orleans Marriott, the JW's elevators were fast and always available. The exercise room had a lot of machines, a great view, and good amenities. The machines were the newest I had ever seen. Finally, after trying to send a prepaid box through the Fed Ex office across the street at the New Orleans Marriott and being told that I had to spend at least $20 to use that office, I dropped the box off at the front desk of the JW Marriott; they called FedEx and had it picked up for free. That's service. Why another hotel in the same company does it differently, right across the street, I have no idea. We visited the new jazz bar downstairs. It is very nice, but a bit pricey. I would probably give this place 5 stars if the internet were free. I will try to use this hotel, though, whenever I go to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great - in every way”
Reviews.Author: LHR123
Reviews.Content: Great location, great service, great room - professional in all regards. Also, now a great new music lounge with the best talent in NOLA. Best value - especially if you spring for the concierge level lounge. The Ritz-Carlton was booked - the JW Marriott was a great alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fun city!”
Reviews.Author: tiggersam00
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to the French Quarter and we made a great choice in choosing the JW Marriott. Great service all around, helpful staff and a great location just stpes from the French Quarter. Walking distance to all shop, restaurants and attractions. WIll be staying here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, luxurious, best staff in nola”
Reviews.Author: stallion114
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend and loved it. I have stayed at several hotels in nola and this one is hands down the best. I was upgraded to a slightly larger room due to my rewards stAtus and it was very nice, spacious, and comfortable. Overall the staff was amazing, extremely friendly and professional. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Weekend parking was valet only and 33 a night which seems to be the std at all the hotels nearby (marriott, crowne plaza, ritz,). If you drive around a little bit you should be able to find a garage for around 15/day. I often park at the garage next to the Hilton Garden Inn which is a couple blocks away from the jw.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient elegance.”
Reviews.Author: KelseyBear
Reviews.Content: Our room was large and clean with free water (a big deal in July) and nice amentities. The location is ideal for exploring the city on foot, as it is close to the French Quarter and Bourbon St. Our biggest hang up was that on the first evening, the fire alarm system malfunctioned from 10pm to 12am. The loudspeaker system reassured us that it was an error and there was no emergency, but with a 3 year old in the room, it was inconvenient. What a nice hotel staff though, as the next morning we had a credit for 2 drinks at the bar or a free in room movie. Well handled.

Reviews.Title: “Best location for a French Quarter visit”
Reviews.Author: nvomy
Reviews.Content: I've been to New Orleans many times but had never stayed in French Quarter area. I'm glad I chose this hotel. The location is within walking distance to all the popular things to do in New Orleans (Bourbon St, Cafe Dumond, River Walk, etc.). The room is a little small but clean and comfortable with modern amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Spottedbass
Reviews.Content: I really expected a bit more from this hotel but overall a very nice stay. Wireless Internet is not available, you can network in for 14.99. day. Rooms were nice but surprisingly small even for NOLA. Robes and coffee in room standard compliments of Marriott. Location was very central to all activities and restaurants. Staff were friendly and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “problem with hot water in shower”
Reviews.Author: zban
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and clean, the one downside was that the hot water cannot get pumped up to high floors well so my husband and I don't have consistent hot water during showers. We were on 28th floor, stayed for 6 nights, 3/18/2011-3/24/2011. We called the concierge and they said the building is old so that's not uncommon. Our friend who is on 30th floor said that he never got hot water for showers, poor thing. And his safe didn't even work, so the hotel gave him a breakfast buffet coupon. And he didn't use it so gave it to us. The breakfast buffet was nice. The chef was very very nice, he doesn't only make omelet and waffle, but also went around to make sure every customer is okay. All the servers are sincere too. That was very good. I think all the staff in the hotel are nice, polite and sincere. Just too bad that the age of the building caused the hot water problems to high floors.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: catherine_stl
Reviews.Content: The JW is outstanding! It certainly compares with other luxury hotels. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly, making sure that we felt comfortable and welcome. This hotel also has a very nice little rooftop pool on the 8th floor that I wished I would have known about before visiting this wonderful hotel. Excellent location, clean and pretty rooms, and very good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: bellref
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many Marriott hotels, but never a JW Marriott. We got a great deal through Expedia since we went during the summer season which is pretty hot and humid. We inquired about an upgrade when we checked in and were pleasantly surprised that they had one floor that was allergy-free. This meant NO FEATHERS. Yay!! (Wish all of the Marriotts had this option.) They gave us a bigger room with a view and it was very comfortable. Best hotel mattresses ever. All of their staff were gracious and responsive. The only downside was that their lobby WiFi was so slow that it was unusable. Excellent central location just steps from the French Quarter and the St Charles trolley line.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Gonster
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights. As a Platinum card holder had upgraded room on 28th floor and access to lounge/free food. All employees had great customer service skills. Location is right in the middle of everything, so you don't need a car to see most sights. Had a nice workout room and smallish pool on the 8th floor. Did not use either. I understand parking is $32 a day. Taxi from/to the airport is a flat $33. For 2 or more people, a taxi is cheaper than the shuttle. Internet was adequate for my use. Free bottled water in room and newspaper delivered to door.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: Mirage2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a conference in June 2011. Overall, a nice hotel with friendly staff, with the exception of the front desk staff when we checked in and the concierge who could have been a little more welcoming. We asked for a quiet room in advance and again at the front desk, and then got put directly across from the ice machine. This was quickly corrected after we called down to the desk to complain, however. The room was clean, spacious and pretty quiet, although we discovered once we had neighbours that you can hear conversations somewhat through the wall. The bed was very comfortable. Gym was great, and so was the pool, although it is much smaller than it looks in the pictures. I was happy with the room we had at the conference rate ($164), but wouldn't be prepared to pay more.

Reviews.Title: “Eh...”
Reviews.Author: Cranky_Traveler
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location on Canal Street across from the French Quarter. Generally I felt it was pretty average. I've never stayed in a JW Marriott before so I'm not sure if it's supposed to be nicer than a regular Marriott, but I can say it's pretty much the same. Same busy chaos in the lobby, overworked staff, rooms that aren't quite what you expected, Internet access that won't work (wireless connections were too far away). Don't have breakfast at Shula's -- it's AWFUL. Worst eggs benedict I've ever seen - the hollandaise sauce was orange and more rubber than liquid, too. Pastries were dry. Parking is $35/night. Way too much. This was the first weekend my husband and I spent away together after the birth of our daughter, now 2, so it was actually really unfortunate that our request for a king size bed was ignored. Wow, how romantic to each have our own bed on our special weekend away. I wouldn't stay here again, because there are a ton of options in NOLA. Nothing about this place stood out.

Reviews.Title: “We'll Be Staying Here Again!”
Reviews.Author: DanK5
Reviews.Content: With almost 300 reviews, what can I add? We really enjoyed staying here and even with five days of fun, we didn't get to nearly all the New Orleans things there are to see and do. So we'll be back, and we'll stay at the JW. It's in a great location if you plan on spending time in the French Quarter; the trollies literally stop right out in front, and good restaurants abound. (The hotel is right on the edge of the French Quarter.) Because of that, there's absolutely no need to rent a car; in fact, I think having a car would be an expensive pain--parking's outrageous and difficult...like any big city. Lots of good stuff to say--maybe even a few things that haven't already been mentioned. Someone complained about the concierge availability but we found just the opposite. Melissa was easy to meet with, and very helpful and knowledgeable about the area. Happy to book some tours which were the highlight of our trip. Wish I remember his name, but one of the doormen was truly outstanding in going beyond the call of duty when we wanted a refrigerator, and when we had a problem getting back in our room one day. He was so helpful, friendly, outgoing and funny, too! Let me mention the good stuff first, and the not so good last. Beds are very comfortable, and our maid service was efficient, friendly, and competent. Good room lighting is important to me, and the JW excelled in that; for example, there was a really well designed, effective, adjustable-position LED reading light mounted on each side of the bed. Also, there's a power strip on the back of the large desk for those myriads of chargers and plug-in thingies so many of us bring with us. Medium size room which was fine for two. Really speedy elevators. The lobby is very well laid out with lots of comfortable sitting areas and tables so you can sip a drink (or free lemonade) and play on your iPad real comfortably. OK, here's some of the not-so-good stuff. I suppose room configurations vary here, but our room had a Motel-6 size bathroom with a Motel 6 size counter area. Matter of fact, I've been in Motel 6 bathrooms which were bigger. For that reason alone, I didn't rate this JW a 5. The $15/day WiFi charge is kind of outrageous (it's free in the lobby, however). It did work well and it was fast. I dunno; maybe in the better hotels such as this one, that price is reasonable and customary--I don't want to be unfair. But if you have 3G access, however, I'd use that first. The view from the room was awful--great view of mostly rusty air conditioning units and other roof tops. I blame that on myself, however, because I should have asked first and didn't. So ask when you reserve and/or check in. Speaking of check in, we asked for and got a late 1:30 PM checkout with no problem (checkout is normally noon). But all in all we really liked it here and as I've said in the headline, I'd definitely book it again. Dan Kap, Whittier, CA DanK5@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel across Canal St from the French Quarter.”
Reviews.Author: ScreamingMiMi98
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with another couple, have stayed at the JW Marriott on Canal St twice out of the last three years for Jazz Fest. We love the hotel and it is always nice and clean. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. They made great recommendations for dinner in the Quarter. The hotel is within walking distance to the Quarter, Central Business District, Poydras (Mother's), and the trolley on St Charles. It is very easy to get a cab. The hotel offers room service, which the boutique hotels in the Quarter do not have. Room service was late one morning but they comp'd it and it was reflected on our bill when we checked out. We did not have to remind them. We have yet to make it to the pool but it is nice to have the option since New Orleans is very hot.

Reviews.Title: “Room worked and uhhhhhhhh....Great Lemonade!”
Reviews.Author: Bimmercando
Reviews.Content: Requested a high floor corner room (early check-in, extra towels, nonfeather pillows) went 0 for 3. Arrived in at 11:30 and told that will be ready at the latest 3 p.m. Returned at 02:15 to check up on the room and it was ready. Quite puzzling as I had left my cell# for reception to call when our preassigned room was ready. No call was rcvd. I must say though that the front desk staff were quite courteous. Room was clean and nice sized. Room fridge and mini safe ( you'll need a chair to be able to view yr contents ). Bathroom/counter space was small, however shower is good due to curtain design. Not great water pressure so the shower was just enough to get by. No bathroom fan so expect the misty mirrors. Checked out the 8th floor outdoor pool and there was no locker room adjacent to their nice gym/workout area which you pass through to go to the pool. With late checkout time at 1 p.m. for most guests who may request such, there is no courtesy shower/room to allow for you to wash up from that New Orleans heat/humidity induced perspiration. Their lobby bathroom is one alternative. So at around 4 p.m. I opted for the less frequented of spots and went a floor up to the conference room level to change. It was a morgue up there. Found a tucked away area by the piano with a table and did a quick change. Figures a security guy would stroll by as I was about to put on my belt. He suspiciously asked, "can I help you ? " for which I simply replied, "only if you want to dress me ! " I then told him I was a guest and my room #, but that didnt seem to be enough for him. Then I scrambled unsuccessfully for the roombill copy and just gave him my room key. Then he returned asking for a name to go with it. Oh Boy ! Parking is $33.00 + a night with many garages 4less around the corner if you have a car that is really not needed in the city, especially if it's a busy time. The porters/doormen were great and more than helpful. They knew their stuff. Be down by 10 a.m. for the morning papers from the front desk. Comp WiFi is near the restaurant and spa, else the usual hotel cash grab from your room. For the best of the rest....The complimentary lemonade at the front desk is well worth the calories ! 2 days in N.O is more than enough. 1 night of the many Bourbon St street odors should be pungent enough for most. - Was awoken @ 09:00 Sunday a.m. by employees in the hallway ( must hv been room service guys ). Should have put a towel at the door bottom P.S. - visited a buddy staying at The W (FQ), beautiful place.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room & great location..”
Reviews.Author: SunSeekerRon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business as Marriott across street was booked up. I liked this hotel as it was quieter then the hustle and bustle of the Marriott Convention Centre which I visited on several occasions. I only slept here so cant speak to the food. I did find the room clean and comfortable, with a wide assortment of pillows provided. The bathroom was clean, and the shower pressure was adequate. Hotel is conveniently located on Canal Street, while only minutes from Bourbon Street - but not too close that you're kept awake all night with loud drunks and music. Bourbon Street is just far away and can certainly be loud, wild and attract a different crowd particularly as the night wears on. The elevators in this hotel were very quick, while I never felt unsafe in the hotel. I didn't see alot of this hotel, but what I saw, I liked..

Reviews.Title: “Good location, disappointing JW”
Reviews.Author: GreyFamilyTX
Reviews.Content: This JW Marriott is an ideal New Orleans location, with a nice lobby and staff, but the rooms are really disappointing for a JW Marriott. You will hear the very loud elevators and the conversations/TV of your neighbors through the paper-thin walls. Small rooms with worn furnishings. I love the Marriott chain, but won't stay here again. And parking is $35 a night....

Reviews.Title: “Good location but a bit worn around the edges”
Reviews.Author: maestrette
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights using Marriott points. The sleeping area of our room was spacious, but the bathroom was too cramped for two people to get ready at the same time. Little things like a moldy ceiling above the shower, snags in the shower curtain, ripped carpeting, etc detracted from the overall experience. Definitely time for a renovation. The location on Canal Street just across from the French Quarter is excellent. Not bad for free with points, but I wouldn't pay for the room. We would try the Marriott across Canal before we stayed here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional People, part 2”
Reviews.Author: Readyright
Reviews.Content: One again, my wife and I spent our annual Memorial Day visit to NOLA at the JW Marriott. It's clean, comforable and relatively quiet for such a large building. Marriott beds are great! My wife loves hangin' out by the pool. I find the staff to be exceptional. (So many of them asked me how I feel, or tell me to have a nice day.) The workers at the reception area, William Jenkins and Janerio V. will go out of their way to find you information or help you check in/out. (Yes it's their job, but they really seem to enjoy what they do.) One morning,I had the breakfast buffet dounstairs at Shula's. There were only a few customers. Since I ordered the buffet, I basically waited on myself, got my own coffee...etc. When I asked for a check, the waiter told me that the breakfest was "no charge". When I asked for an explanation, he apologized for "not giving me enough attention." I was amazed. It's an indication of how this hotel values customer satifaction. I love staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location........”
Reviews.Author: LostTravellers
Reviews.Content: Convenient location near Bourbon Street. Everything within walking distance. Trolly stops out front and around the corner. We spent five days in a great room on the 29th floor with an incredible view of the Mississippi river and the French Quarter. The room had a comfortable bed, was nicely decorated and had a LCD TV. Good water pressure & A/C. The elevators were fast, never had to wait longer than 30 seconds. On the downside, there is no WiFi in the room, only wired access. Wifi is only available in the lobby area. No guest fridge â€“ mini bar only. There is only valet parking available and the entrance is behind the building on Common Street. The cost is $32 but that is to be expected in a city with limited parking space availability. The only problem that we encountered was with our bathtub. It was recently reglazed but it wasnâ€™t done properly so it was peeling off like a bad manicure. It didnâ€™t bother us because it was so hot in New Orleans that we just wanted a shower. The front desk seemed surprised when we informed them about it. We were told that they were going to look into it and get back to us. Have yet to hear anything from the hotel management.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: thelefamily
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in right on Canal Street, two block from Bourbon street. This is a very nice hotel with very comfortable beds. We were on the concierge floor with access to the club room. Unfortunately, the club room was closed on Sunday. We will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Jazzfest”
Reviews.Author: joynceddy
Reviews.Content: Came to this hotel with a friend for Jazzfest. Nice location, beautiful hotel, great staff. Only wished they had a hot tub to soak our aching feet after walking so much. We dipped our feet in the rooftop pool. Overall great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, right near the action, but not Too close!”
Reviews.Author: worldtripper
Reviews.Content: We had a room on the 30th floor, over looking the French Quarter and the River. You do not need to stay any closer to the French Quarter, you basicall walk across the street! (Canal). Great room, frig in room. ONLY complaint is NO wifi!!!! What??? It was a PAIN IN THE REAR to have us both on the web, we took turns. We had just left a 100 year old hotel that had FREE wifi! So....THIS WAS NOT GOOD. I would stay here again but they need wifi!!! We didn't eat at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fabulous city”
Reviews.Author: JilleefromPhilee
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for business. But at made a trip that was purely pleasure. And what a pleasure it was! We love New Orleans and decided to get married during Jazz Fest 2011 in what I consider one of the most amazing cities in the world. Everything about the JW Marriott was fabulous! Starting with the amazing staff (especially William). It was great to always be greeted upon our return to the hotel with such a warm welcome. The front desk staff were always professional and very helpful. The rooms were large and comfortable - and always cleaned to perfection, the hotels common areas (lobby, bars ...) were a great place to sit and relax and the location couldn't have been more perfect. The location was close enough to all the wildness of Bourbon Street to walk in less than 8 minutes, but far enough away to be able to relax and have some quite. We are surely planning on staying at this specific Marriott again and would recommend it to our friends and family

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay for Jazz Fest”
Reviews.Author: svoluse
Reviews.Content: We stay for 3 nights at the JW Marriott for the second weekend of Jazz Fest. The lobby are of the hotel is very attractive as are the rooms. However, it was the staff that really made our stay at this hotel enjoyable. Upon arriving at the hotel we were checked in and up to our room within 5 minutes. We heading out to the French Quarter to wander around for awhile. A couple of hours laters we returned to the hotel to get ready for our dinner reservations. We stopped by the front desk to see if we could get a key for the mini bar, they said there actually wasn't a mini bar in our room but they could send up a refrigerator for us to use. We said that would be great and headed to our room to change for dinner. Within 5 minutes a refrigerator was delievered and plugged in, so we headed to dinner. We had a leisurely dinner and some time on Bourbon Street before returning to our room. When we got into the room, about 5 hours later, we checked the refrigerator and discovered it hadn't gotten cold at all. We called the front desk and within minutes they were there with another refrigerator. It was delievered by the same employee, David as the first one. He apologized several times and said the new refrigerator should be cooling down quickly. Rather than leaving right away he waited a few minutes to see it the fan on the new refrigerator came on, it didn't. So he called the maintence office who sent someone else up to see what was going on. Turns out the electrical socket was bad and after switching sockets the fan on the refrigerator came on instantly. David again apologized and insisted on sending up a cheese tray and bottle of wine for the inconvience. We finally agreed and about 10 minutes the cheese tray and bottle of wine were personally delievered by David. This was not something that had to be done but we really appreciated it and this is one of the reason we will stay at the JW Marriott next time we are in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect but...”
Reviews.Author: Piolina
Reviews.Content: This place has a great location on Canal St, just steps from the Quarter. The bedrooms are spacious and well appointed, everything is clean, and the beds are very comfortable. Staff was nice and attentive. However, the internet service was the biggest disappointment. We were told the--way overpriced--charge of $14.95 was good for 24 hours. However both days the connection ended at noon. Since check-in starts at 3 pm, there is no way you can ever get it for 24 hours (we actually checked in late in the evening so it was only good for a few hours). Moreover, the "self-service business center" is a joke. You "rent" computers and pay 49 cents for each minute online. Quite ridiculous for such a big hotel where I'm sure many conferences and business meetings are hosted. Aside from that it's a great choice if you don't need/want to be online.

Reviews.Title: “25th Anniversary guests extremely satisfied”
Reviews.Author: rj1986
Reviews.Content: The 4 of us arrived around 6:00 p.m.April12th greeted by very friendly staff. One of the employees noticed a Canadian flag on my suitcase and asked us where we were from and if we had ever been to NOLA before. We said it was our first time and that both couples were here celebrating 25th wedding anniversaries. He welcomed us and wished us a happy anniversary. We had a few hours before our dinner reservation so we checked out Burbon Stret and a few others. When we returned to our rooms we found champagne on ice and chocolate covered strawberries in each room.(Full bottles of good champagne) What a way to start a vacation. The next 6 days for the 4 of us were way too short. There are far too many good restaurants, bars, neighborhoods, etc. to visit in such a short time. I would like to thank the gentlemen who spoke with us that first night in the Marriott. I did not get his name and I did not see him again during our stay. I am pretty sure he had everything to do with the Champagne and strawberries. Jw give this man a raise! We will definatley be returning to your hotel someday soon. RPS from Burnaby,B.C.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business trips”
Reviews.Author: Roadtravlr
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the jw for two nights on business. upon check-in, i greeted warmly by all the staff--really nice and friendly. The front desk person let me know of all the events in the area. The hotel itself was really nice--marble floors, a built-in art gallery and gathering area--perfect for meeting with others. My room was on the 26th floor--it was well furnished, clean with 2 double beds. I also had free Wifi--which shocked me. i thought there was a fee, but perhaps because I'm a Marriott rewards member, it was covered. The wifi was quick and very reliable. The fitness room was good--small, but with quality workout machines (Life Fitness) and free weights, mats, stability balls. The location of the hotel was right on canal street--near everything and close to the street car lines. Overall a good stay and I would definitely recommend this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kr2travel
Reviews.Content: My sister, her husband and I stayed at the JW Marriott on Canal St. and it was one of the best hotels I've stayed in for some time. The Marriott Hotel is directly across Canal St. and is a typical downtown Marriott hotel with all the services but the JW is quite a notch above and I would recommend this hotel over any others when staying in New Orleans. The staff is very courteous and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay. No bed bug in my room.”
Reviews.Author: Patty1234
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with Priceline and I got a good deal. The room was clean, comfortable and quiet. Previous reviews indicated the possible presence of bed bugs and I was worried I checked my mattress thoroughly and it was clear. Room 1706 had no bed bugs. It was a pleasant stay and I was happy.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel in a let down of a town”
Reviews.Author: kekwiatkowski
Reviews.Content: When booking our stay at New Orleans, I thought a Marriott would be a safe choice. This hotel is extraordinarily overpriced for what it is: the rooms are worn & run down; the bed is at least 10 years old, you can feel the springs in your back; the wired internet which costs $14.99/24 hours only works on 1 side of the hotel and it is slower than dial-up speed; has no room service between 11pm-6am; the direct tv selection is poor & limited; concierge refers you to sketchy tour groups. Overall, NOLA was a massive disappointment for us. Soon as you get on the shuttle from the airport, you are taken through projects and people sleeping under overpasses - this sets the tone for your stay. There is rubbish in the street; constant smell of raw sewerage; sidewalks are shattered; can't walk around at night without feeling unsafe and almost every server, tour guide, information counter hates their job and hates tourists. Oh and had to request a fridge & extra pillows because they ignored my internet request for them. The only positive is the National WW2 Museum. This is excellent and the only reason to go to NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Company paying, thrilled with the stay!”
Reviews.Author: BMB2525
Reviews.Content: What a perfect location! And every provider was awesome EXCEPT I always got the same server in the lounge area and she was always grumpy (three days in a row). I will also say, don't eat in the hotel restaurant (MUCH better restaurants within a 1-2 minute walk)(but room service was FABULOUS) By chance I was there the week before Mardi Gras, so LOTS of activity. Took a little to get used to the elevators but all in all a great stay, highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “basic JW”
Reviews.Author: FAMILY44444
Reviews.Content: If you like the basic glitz of the JW brand, this is for you. I prefer the Courtyards, but the courtyard around the corner got some bad reviews (here and elsewhere). Anyway, the JW is fine, fancy wood instead of wallpaper, chandeliers and art in the lobby, all tile in the bathrooms, etc. location is across the street from Bourbon street, on the streetcar line and convenient to most of the other CBD attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for exploring New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: laurabelle64
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to New Orleans and we stayed at this hotel both times. the first time it was just my husband and I and it was a great couples getaway. This time we brought the kids. It is perfectly situated on canal st. right across from the french qtr. You can walk easily to the waterfront, aquarium, french qtr, and french market. Right outside the door you can hop on the cable car and go to the other popular areas, such as the garden district. The concierge was very helpful with finding things to do and make suggestions. The pool is small and it has no hot tub, which would have been nice after a long day of walking. But, the kids enjoyed the pool. Parking is expensive, but it is great to not have to worry about driving where you want to go and know that your car is safe. I would recommend this hotel to anyone new to New Orleans. One thing to know that is helpful - as you approach the hotel on canal st, drive past the hotel, and turn rt on magazine st and then rt on commons to the Marriott parking in the back, where you can drop off your car and check in. One other thing - the bathrooms are quite small. This made it a challenge with 4 people.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great location”
Reviews.Author: gt1229
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights 2/25/11 and 2/26/11. I booked using Priceline and got a great deal for the weekend then when I was checking in the wonderful front desk lady upgraded us to a deluxe corner room for only $15.00 per night. The room was very spacious with very nice amenities. Very comfortable bed and pillows. The entire staff including the valet, bellhop,front desk and the bar tenders went out of their way to make us feel very welcome the entire weekend. The location of the hotel right on Canal street puts you right across the street from the French Quarter and within walking distance of some really great places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Small noisy room”
Reviews.Author: traveler117629
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a nice quiet room, try another hotel. I always thought the JW brand was their premier locations, this motel's elevators scream as they travel up and down. Who can sleep?

Reviews.Title: “I held a great conference here and everyone was pleased”
Reviews.Author: amy2876
Reviews.Content: I am a meeting planner for a national not-for-profit organization and we just had a meeting here at the end of January. My collegues and I had a great experience with this hotel from start to finish and our attendee evaluations (150 of them) all came back positive. So you can kind of consider this review 150 in 1. This hotel has a very friendly and accommodating staff, great food, and very clean, comfortable and stylish rooms. The location for us was perfect as well. Bourbon Street is within walking distance and the trolley that takes you to the Garden District is just a block away. We did have one problem - some of our attendee "prizes" (two t-shirts and a couple of mardi gras masks) were stolen out of our meeting room. The hotel promptly over-reimbursed us (shirts and masks cost us about $35, they gave us $50 and some choc. covered strawberries) for the items and apologized profusely. This is a great hotel, in a great location with great staff - what more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Great for business in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: JJnero
Reviews.Content: The good - clean, well appointed and relatively modern rooms; good location on Canal, with an entrance on Common, away from the riff raff on Canal; good service and nice gym; nice concierge lounge The bad - no wifi, at all The ugly - no wifi, at all, c'mon this is the flagship brand!

Reviews.Title: “Love This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: valbres
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. On Canal Street across from the Quarter so you miss all the noise but have easy access to everything. Beautiful room with a river view, the staff were all very friendly and helpful. Wonderful experience. Marriott's bizarre Ibahn Internet connection still remains one of the kludgiest but hopefully one day soon they will throw it down and move into the 21st century.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is in a good location with a very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: marieh97
Reviews.Content: The hotel is adjacent to the French Quarter so it is vey convenient to the many, many restaurants, bars and shops. The staff was so friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location, good service”
Reviews.Author: Traveller3486
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a medical convention. Originally I was booked at the New Orleans Marriott across the street but was bumped up to the JW due to overbooking. This hotel is very clean and the staff are incredibly accommodating. Be sure to talk with the concierge on great places to eat! In the five nights we stayed, he never led us astray!! The location is great- walking distance to the French Quarter and Bourbon Street. I would skip Bourbon and see the French Quarter first- it's very beautiful. My room was well cleaned daily and it was very quiet in the rooms at night despite the downtown location. There was a fee for internet in the room. We never tried the restaurant on site, but the bar did ok.

Reviews.Title: “Nobody knows what the other is doing”
Reviews.Author: Detroiter248
Reviews.Content: I am sick of writing/talking about my experience here, so I will just cut and paste my last email to their customer service. So many things went wrong during our 2 day stay there, I believe it really is a process problem. Staff are so disconnected from each other, it is not funny anymore. (and I am a Marriott elite, this is the worst service I got at a Marriott) -------- Hello, Could you please check your records again on the 2nd charge of $XXX.00. This was taken out of our bill by the manager on duty when we were checking out BECAUSE MARRIOTT MADE SO MANY MISTAKES during our stay there. We didn't ask for it, we were given by the manager because there were so many problems and mistakes by Marriott staff. I see this charge as ANOTHER MISTAKE in a chain of mistakes during our stay with JW Marriott New Orleans!! I thought this was behind us but obviously it wasn't so here I go again telling/writing someone what happened. 1) We made a reservation for the "romance package" which included champagne and strawberries when we arrived. When we arrived it wasn;t there, so we called and asked that it be ready in the evening when we get back from dinner. When we came back, it STILL WAS NOT THERE. Then the manager came late with the package, apologized, etc. 2) Our breakfast was charged to our room eventhough it was in the package 3) In our last day, even though our package included late check out, and further, even though we asked again for confirmation of our late check out, and further more even though there was a "DO NOT DISTURB" sign on the door, here came loud loud knocks on the door (as if a landlord knocks on a unpaying tenant). There she was, the cleaning staff!!! I remember staying in W and ordering room service, and I received a call saying "Sorry sir, our room service is outside your room but can't knock the door since you have a do-not-disturb sign on". 4) Now this!! I get charged the $xxx which was provided without asking for it as an apology. How incompetent a hotel management system and staff can be!!!! Obviously, it is a system, process and HR problem. I will write directly to your CEO because nobody through out the chain could get it right!!! Marriott New Orleans does not deserve the JW classification if JW really stands for something!!! Good day!! XXXXXX

Reviews.Title: “everything seemed easy”
Reviews.Author: MsChi-V-S
Reviews.Content: Marriots are usually great and this one was too. Everyone was friendly and happy and accommodating. Great proximity to everything and wonderful views. It's so close to Bourbon St. that I heard the street musicians bounce music around 7pm and it called me out...don't worry it wasn't loud...I have great hearing and it was slight but enough to draw a music lover like me. The place was packed due to American idol auditions being in town. The second night I stayed in a different room to get another perspective/view. This building has a very interesting design with large windows in the outer corner of the room which really optimize the view . The only very small details that did not "wow" me...the pool seemed a bit small and kinda luke warm and very urban with only concrete in site even so I enjoyed it and suprizingly the restaurant closes at 10 with last orders placed at 9:30. After gallavanting around town I noticed the rooftop pool at the Westin so as soon as there was a room available I moved over there to enjoy yet another perspective of this crazy town. Loved it!!! Oh I was gallavanting around town via bike and both hotels were very bike friendly!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: jt_28
Reviews.Content: We booked our room through Priceline so we got it cheaper than regular price. I loved the location and the room was fantastic. We upgraded to a corner room and the view was nice. Shula's Steakhouse was really good. The bed was really comfortable. Really close to Bourbon but far enough away that you could sleep at night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: jayne94
Reviews.Content: Great location. French quarter right across the street. I had a corner room with king bed. Mattress was very comfortable. Also very convenient for using the trolley. Definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Satisfactory Experience”
Reviews.Author: themelissard
Reviews.Content: JW Marriott is what you'd expect of most mid-range chain hotels. It's clean, well maintained, welcoming -- but nothing to write home about. The design and guest experience is what I expected it to be. The staff are nice and friendly. The gym has good equipment, the pool is on the smallish side but was empty because it was winter. The location is great, right in the French Quarter and the street car lines, so you can pretty much get anywhere in the city. It's a great option if you want to be in the center of town, and don't care about having super design-focused customer experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AniJayKhatch
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! The location is great - very convenient to the Harrah's area, and also to Bourbon/French Quarter. The hotel itself is beautiful and comfortable. The only problem was that the first day we were there, our room did not get serviced at all - and we were out of the room the entire day! When we went to the front desk later that evening to request some towels because our room had not been serviced, they didn't even apologize. Not that we were expecting anything, but just an apology would have been appreciated. Our room was serviced the following day, and we did love the room and the hotel - would consider staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “great people”
Reviews.Author: jwdatty
Reviews.Content: the continuity of the staff is the greatest asset of this hotel. it is comforting to be welcomed at the door (tim, alfred etals), isabelle at the concierage desk, and our friends deborah and heather at the lobby bar. we have nevered stayed at a hotel where the staff remains constant and knows their guests the way the jw does.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and vibe”
Reviews.Author: scrambled_legs
Reviews.Content: Overall a great place to stay if you don't mind spending a little more for the ambiance. New Orleans is amazing and there are lots of great hotels to choose from. I have nothing bad to say about this one. The rooms may be a little small but other than that great location, style and feel for a hotel in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice convenient facilities, less than par service”
Reviews.Author: houston_traveler120
Reviews.Content: While on an annual business trip to Louisiana we switched from a hotel in the northshore area to this hotel on our last night to be in the French Quarters. The location is perfect to go out in the quarters as its right on Canal Street. The facilities are very nice, both the lobby and the rooms. When we arrived they could not find my reservation and that was quite a hassle but it finally worked out, but not without frustration and 30 minutes waiting for the receptionist to figure it out. My mini-bar was broken so there were no snacks. When I got back from a night on Bourbon Street I wanted a bite to eat but room service was closed (what happened to 24 hour room service!). I did not use the gym or the restaurant so can not not attest to those. I got a corporate rate for $130/night so that was an outstanding price for a JW, so I would stay here again at this rate, but I would not say this hotel is worth paying rackroom rate. Parking was almost $30/night - outrageous, but fairly standard for most hotels in the French Quarters.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Staff Made the diffference between ordinary and extraordinary!”
Reviews.Author: johnnieb
Reviews.Content: If you are a seasoned traveler, you understand that things can go wrong anywhere, but its how problems are handled, that makes the difference in your impressions. This is a nice, clean, "JW" that was a retrofit of another hotel...smallish baths, but otherwise well equipped rooms, tasteful, great Marriot bedding...We seemed to have a variety of things go wrong, but Kim and the front desk, went above and beyond to try to make things right, and you really get the sense that these employees love the business and this hotel....That alone will win us back for another stay....I have renewed faith in service industry employees.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: stantsy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the JW from Oct 30--Nov 2, check in was easy, check out was even easier. Did not spend a lot of time at the hotel but it has a nice pool area, lobby was nice all in all and the JW met all my expectations I have in a hotel or JW calibre. Room was nice, king bed was so comfortable and room met all expectations and was cleaned very well daily by the cleaning staff (keep up the good work). New Orleans is awesome, JW is perfectly located on Canal street and close (walking distance) to almost everything you want to visit in NOLA. Somethings of interest, Casamento's for oysters (4 thousand and something Magazine street), Surrey's for breakfast (have to have the banana's foster french toast (to die for), (I think 1482 Magazine street) both are located on Magazine street with Casamento's being the further away. Gotta love New Orleans, 3rd time back and hope not the last.....

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: BaidowFamily
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to New Orleans in celebration of our 10th anniversary. JW Marriott's location is perfect: walking distance to Bourbon Street, Jackson Square, Riverwalk etc. Front desk staff were professional, not especially go-out-of their-way. Room was ok, but comfortable bedding. There was not enough hot water if you showered at night. Restaurant manager was courteous, but the omelette station woman was quite unpleasant. Despite her giving my husband an attitude when he ordered his omelette, he continued to be polite. She came around and told us her sob-story of how she's sick etc. (TMI). Not very professional. Chef Frank came around the tables to find out how everyone liked the breakfast. We reserved the room with breakfast; so if you did too, make sure that you are not charged for the breakfast. Somehow the restaurant's system does not communicate with the front desk, we were charged for breakfast. It was all straightened-out eventually, but it was not hassle-free.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sablewolf
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked our trip through JetBlue Getaways. We felt that we got a great deal. This hotel was very clean, upscale and we felt we had great service. The room was small but nice. We requested double beds. We had a great view of Canal street and the French Quarter. We were also able to see the river. We ordered breakfast for the morning the night before, using an order form placed in the room. You select the time that is should be brought. You have to place the order on the outside of the room door before midnight.There were great selections. Our breakfast arrived on time and it was fresh tasty and plentiful. There is a gym on the 8th floor and internet service is available for a fee. The location of the JW is perfect - 5 minute walk to the Quarter and a 10 minute walk to the Riverwalk and Harrah's casino. We were very happy and will stay at this hotel whenever we come back to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the extra money”
Reviews.Author: ersinbaba
Reviews.Content: I am a silver Marriott member and we stayed in 7 different Marriott Hotels in last two months with my wife. My wife has chosen this hotel to try a "JW". We liked the location indeed. However, we payed almost 2 times of what we payed to the other Marriott hotels and this one did not stand out. Overall I think the hotel is nice but a little overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: cabobaby
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Located on Canal Street, the JW Marriott was central to many of New Orleans main attractions. You could walk to Bourbon Street, Royale Street, and the Riverwalk. The staff is very friendly and our room was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: bubby4823
Reviews.Content: I was in New Orleans for the first time recently with a group of church friends. We stayed at the JW Marriott and had a great stay. The rooms were large and comfortable and the service was terrific. They brought us extra pillows, extra towels pretty much anything we needed they provided and did it all with a smile. I would stay here every time I come to New Orleans which is a great city, by the way.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: ponder72
Reviews.Content: While in New Orleans for the Atlanta Falcons - New Orleans Saints game we booked a deluxe corner room for two nights. I typically try to stay in 5 star or more boutique style hotel but I was traveling with a group who had opted to stay here. Upon arrival we were greeted with very warm customer service. Check in time took less than 5 minutes. The room size was a little small but served it's purpose. The bed was very comfortable. The mini fridge has a disclaimer on the door stating that it only chills items and it not designed to get items "cold". So please do not think you will be able to store leftovers or your personal beverages in the refrigerator. However one of the couples traveling with us requested a mini fridge be brought to their room and it was quickly brought up and this fridge kept items extremely cold. So just know that this is an option. Please note 24 room service ends at 12 midnight. We did order room service for breakfast and it took less than 30 minutes and it was delicious and very plentiful. The hotel was located 2 blocks from Bourbon street and approx a 4 - 5 minute walk to Harrah's Casino and Riverwalk.

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs bites and horrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: mekamax
Reviews.Content: If you go to bedbugregistry.com you'll see this hotel is listed as having bedbugs on several different ocassions. See for yourself. I attached photos of the 18 bites she woke up with. We spent the week at the urgent treatment center, dealing with disrespectful staff, and having to get rid of our belongings. I'm still disguisted with their desire to keep the incident hidden from other customers only. They accused my coworker of lying about the bites only to have another traveler capture a bed bug in his bed a week later.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean, and amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: klyles29
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend after a Saints game. I've stayed at several hotels in New Orleans, being a resident of LA and I absolutely underestimated this hotel. It is right off of Canal ST, about a block away from Burbon where all the action is. Its much nicer than the regular Marriott across the street. Upon entering the room, you feel like royalty. We had a corner suite and it was absolutely beautiful views of the city. Very nice decor and furnishings, clean sheets, and soft robes. Even a nice flat screen. The shower was much nicer than expected. The fridge and room came stocked with goodies, with an up-charge of course but thats to be expected. The only downside was that there was no microwave. Weird. We ordered room service for breakfast and dinner two nights and they have an amazing chef in the kitchen! We stayed in the room most of the Saturday we were there so housekeeping did not come by. When we called the front desk to order towels, they were very apologetic and even sent us a note about the lack of towels. Very great staff and very beautiful hotel. Will be staying here from now on.

Reviews.Title: “The Big Easy was not so easy”
Reviews.Author: paraclete58
Reviews.Content: Pulled up on canal st in rental car, to see a sign saying to drive 2 blocks and come back to rear of building for parking and check in. We did so to find it the only parkingis valet and it is 32.00 per night! Then after we got our own luggage out of trunk and carrie it into small lobby, there was no one to assist usto our room. It was only 8:30PM so don't know why there was not a bell man. We got to our room on the 24th floor, and our room was nice enough but laid out terribly. The bathroom door touched the toilet when being opened or closed, and there were no shelves to put toiletries on. One very small countertop surface that also held a stand style make up mirror, so there was no room. In the room itself, to get to the drawer, you had to open a cabinet door that touched the end of the bed when opening, so again, very strange layout. While trying to unpack had to close cabinet door to be able to get to closet. No big deal but frustrating. We went out to explore a little while. Came back to room and went to bed. At 5:00 AM I heard a tapping on my door...got up and looked out, and there was a guy cleaning the doorframes of all the rooms. Are you kidding me? 5AM???? Went back to bed and at 8:00AM I heard a noise at the door again. Housekeeping had key in door and was walking in. Good thing I had top latch secured. Noise in hallway all night both nights made for a very long 2 nights without much sleep. We used the pool on the 8th floor on Friday afternoon. There was one other couple there and when the woman got out of the pool, she walked 2 steps then slipped on the very slippery tile surrounding the pool and landed flat on her back. Her husband went to get ice for her, but I was amazed that no one from the staff came to check on her. When I got out of pool, I too almost fell. Wrong type of tile to be around a pool. Location is great, and hotel is very clean, but I think I will look elsewhere for my next trip to the Big Easy. My last few stays to Marriott properties seems to be going downhill

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel two minutes away from the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Countrybob
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to this hotel for many years. I remember when it used to be a Le Meridien. Then it was the Grand Hotel, now the JW. I love the location. It is not IN the Quarter so you can get some sleep at night, but you can be IN the Quarter in two minutes walking. Also, all other highlights I want to visit in New Orleans are in walking distance. The hotel itself is probably four star, a boutique hotel. The rooms I get are always nice and my only complain could be that they donÂ´t have a minibar that I can use as refrigerator. Complimentary bottles of water, ok pool, friendly staff, I can recommend it. I had one disappointing experience recently: I called the concierge and asked about where the free walking tour starts in the city and when. I could have googled it within a minute (if the room had free internet). But it took the concierge (it was the bell boy) over an hour and three calls to my room to get me the info, which proved to be totally wrong. ThatÂ´s not to their normal standard. Also, they try to sell the tours at the desk, that they get a cut from (local operators). I insisted of using Grayline but they would not give me their brochure. I also asked for the next Bank of America ATM and was sent to the Mariott across the street, which did not have one. There is free wifi in the lobby. I wish they will soon put it in all the rooms. Also, the TV variety could have been bigger. The Shula steakhouse was really very expensive. Did not eat there but donÂ´t understand why other people do. It is way overpriced. I will definitely come back though on my next stay in the Big Easy. I payed 116 dollars a night for a twin room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, good location”
Reviews.Author: Tramp08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at JW Marriott for 2 nights. The property is very nicely decorated with crystal chandelier in the front lobby. The hallway leading from Canal Street to the lobby via the bar and the sitting area is beautiful with lots of art work on the walls. The front desk staff was friendly and attentive. The room was quite roomy and modern and the bed was VERY comfortable. There were complimentary water bottles and coffee maker, and you can get also the complimentary newspaper from the lobby. The very good restaurant, the Palace Cafe, is on the over side of the street. We had a Sunday brinch there ans the food was delicious, - the best eggs benedict ever. Only negatives: The hotel did not offer free internet access, and the breakfast was not included in the room price.

Reviews.Title: “A restful haven in an active city!”
Reviews.Author: Homechef01
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently to New Orleans and find this hotel to be consistently excellent. The bell hops and front desk teams are appropriately polite and excude southern charm. I have seen them treat business travelers and tourists with children equally with respect. I find the roooms to be clean and represent the JW Marriott brand very well. As a returning guest, I am often greated with a "wecome back" note, handy concierge lounge schedule and my preferences honored. I find the quality of bed linens and bath toiletries inviting and the views of NOLA from the upper floors wonderful. This last visit, I was on the 27th floor with views of Canal Street and the French Quarter. The location is an easy walk to the Central Business District, French Quarter, French Market and Harrahs. While there are some great restaurants in walking distance, I have also enjoyed the room service menu. During this visit I sampled the Shrimp Po Boy and Chicken Tenders with the Pepper Jelly. My server was very personable and helpful; and my meals came piping hot and prepared as requested. This is the only hotel I would stay at in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience and Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: rwethereyet850
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed the stay - staff could not have been more hospitable. Was in New Orleans for a quick family get-away and this location was perfect. Easy walking distance to the Riverwalk, the Quarter, and Jackson Square ( I've reached the age where the frozen coffee at Cafe DuMonde is easier than a hurricane!). Realy liked that you drop the car at the rear of the hotel and a main entrance at the front puts you right onto Canal Street at a prime spot. Really pleased with the room - very lush accomodations throughout the hotel. Bathroom is a little bit of a squeeze if you've got multiple toiletry kits but not a major impact. Outdoor pool on 8th floor is really nice as we were able to actually catch a breeze and escape the mugginess after a long day. The hotel was pretty full due to a Saints/Texans pre-season game but there were never crowds or problems getting where you needed to be - maybe that's why it's the Big Easy. The parking is a little on the high side of price ($32/night), but it was worth it to not hassle with parking and to worry about your vehicle's safety. I also like the Country Inn and Suites down on Magazine, but the JW is a class above. Nawlins is back, folks - go check it out and stay at the JDub.

Reviews.Title: “Right by the french quarter and trolley...”
Reviews.Author: BadgerbadenATL
Reviews.Content: Right by the french quarter and trolley lines to get you to the garden district. Seems to be surrounded by other hotels. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Beds very comfortable and nice view down canal street. Used the pool--pretty small but wasn't too busy when used. Seems furniture was new and nice. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location...great value”
Reviews.Author: shaq78
Reviews.Content: Traveled to the area with 3 of my girlfriends for the annual Essence Music Festival over the 4th of July weekend. The hotel was in a perfect location, close to everything....shopping and sightseeing within walking distance! Hotel staff was professional, prompt and accomodating. Hotel was clean and comfortable. A little pricey, but that was due to the events/festival that was taking place that weekend. Hotel was the perfect location, but tucked away enough to avoid the rush of noise from the surrounding areas. Would stay here again and definitely recommend to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: encognito
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a trip to New Orleans and stayed at this hotel. The hotel staff was phenomenal and the hotel itself is beautiful. I stayed on the 25th floor with a corner view and it was great! The hotel amenities are nice and I absolutely loved the fitness center and pool area. I will definitely be returning back to this hotel during my next visit to New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: antiepea
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the JW Marriott for four days. The hotel was wonderful. The room was exceptionally clean (I'm very picky when it comes to cleanliness). Rented a car and used the valet parking. Was very impressed with the parking staff. They knew my name when I came for my car. They were extremely nice and made us feel so welcomed. After touring all day, when I came back to the hotel every night, I was glad I chose the JW Marriott. Won't stay anywhere else from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Adjacent to the French Quarter, but away from the hubub”
Reviews.Author: SoakUpTheEnergy
Reviews.Content: This is a great base for exploring the French Quarter. If you want to be right near the Quarter, but still be able to get a great night's sleep - this is THE place to stay. There are great hotels right within the Quarter. However, in many of these you will hear a lot of street noise throughout the night. The J.W. does not have the old-world ambience of the hotels in the quarter. it is a "modern" hotel. But if you are mostly looking just to sleep in your hotel, and otherwise will be out and about, this is the way to go. The place is very clean, extremely quiet, and ideally located.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience of my life”
Reviews.Author: Travel1234Travel_10
Reviews.Content: Worst experience with a hotel that I've ever had. I booked a room for June way back in April. First they lost my money and said they had no room. I have been fighting with them for the past few months trying to get it straightened out. It is now mere weeks before I am headed down there and it still isn't in order. Management it absolutely terrible. The people answering the phone were incredibly rude. You couldn't pay me enough to go through all this trouble again with this hotel. DON'T BOOK HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Building, Excecptional People”
Reviews.Author: Readyright
Reviews.Content: I spent a long Memorial Weekend solo in NOLA. I'm part of that group of travelers that prefer the large chains to the boutique hotels. What some travelers might call "cookie cutter" hotels means "clean & consistant comfort" to me. Furthermore, the employees of the hotel put in the extra effort to make your stay more relaxing and enjoyable. EXAMPLE: While having breakfast in the hotel, I saw a CHEF (not a waiter/waitress)personally serve food to an elderly couple, making sure that the meal met their special dietary concerns. Over the weekend I witnessed several events of this type. Everybody knows that the JW has a great location and is beautifully (modern) decorated, but their concern for customers puts them on top of my list of favorite places to stay. While dining at Shula's Restaurant in the hotel (great food!), I met Donna Brown, the Operations Manager of the JW property. She exuded energy and pride while talking about her worker's committment to excellence. I felt good just listening her her, because her committment to excellence is a committment to ME! I'm going back to NOLA in a few months and I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, clean room, but still disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: Lucy4242
Reviews.Content: It was great when we arrived before 11am and they already had our room ready. We headed to the 22nd floor and had a corner room. The view was so-so but the room was fairly small. We had concierge lounge access so we went up to get some waters and check it out. We were informed that the lounge would be closed for over a week due to renovations and it would be relocated to a small room off the lobby. The next morning, the renovations started... at 6am. Every morning of our 3 night stay began that way. Loud drilling was heard till almost 6pm one day out of our 3 day stay. Not so relaxing! We were still able to enjoy the breakfast, appetizers, and honor bar at the concierge lounge but it seemed like EVERYONE at the hotel was as well. The front desk clerks were asked what was going on in that room. The clerk then told the guest that since they had low occupancy, they could go ahead in and grab a snack. Sorry, I was a bit upset after spending $40/night more for the access that this person wasn't spending that! We were looking forward to taking advantage of the free wireless access in the lounge and the exclusive setting like we've experienced at all other Marriotts. DEFINITELY did not get that! Like others have said, the location was great. Jackson Square was a 10 minute walk, the river 5, Bourbon just across the street... doesn't get much better then that! I felt 100% safe walking around late at night in that area. Maybe try it again after the renovations are over but I think I'd rather stay at the much nicer looking Marriott right across Canal!

Reviews.Title: “Top flight hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maineguy51
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott in New Orleans was wonderful. Beautiful 22nd floor corner room. The front desk people were attentive and provided excellent service. Nice pool, on the small side. Great bed and linens. Enjoyed the nice large flat scree TV. Great location, close to the french quarter. Would definetly stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good quality, good pricing”
Reviews.Author: Travelbeat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on Canal Street (address maybe on an other street) and easy walking to the French Quarter (Burbon St. two blocks away) and casino and River Front (and I think walking to the Convention Center). There is a Shula SteakHouse in hotel but who wants chain restuarants (even if excellent) when there are so many great independents in NOLA).

Reviews.Title: “Timing is Everything to Make this Affordable”
Reviews.Author: RetiredTravelerTN
Reviews.Content: The J W Marriott in New Orleans is an excellent place to stay for either business or leisure. On the business side of Canal Street, it is convenient to the downtown business area, but one has only to walk across Canal Street to enter the French Quarter area. Royal Street and Bourbon Street are only a few blocks away and easily accessed on foot. We were glad not to be staying in the noisy French Quarter and are certain that we slept better by staying just outside that area. The location is downtown, however, and you will hear some sirens. The hotel public areas are contemporary elegant â€“ clean and inviting. The reception area is adequate but can feel small if you happen to arrive at the same time as 30 other guests. The staff is efficient and calm in handling high-volume times. Two computers in the corner of the lobby (one dedicated to airport check-in) are almost constantly in use. Our room is beautiful â€“ crisp, smooth white linens on the king-size bed with one of the most comfortable mattresses and pillows Iâ€™ve ever slept on. Granite top cabinet and desk, a task chair, 2 upholstered chairs, a glass-top iron table, and 2 nightstands complete the room. Large windows look out to the city providing as much entertainment as the flat panel TV. The bathroom is not spacious but is well-maintained and is appointed with toiletries and good towels. Even the hallways and elevator areas are attractive as you move about the hotel. We were fortunate to obtain a weekend AAA rate which made this hotel an affordable extravagance for us. Nothing special was going on in town to draw tourists, so we even got complimentary breakfast buffet at Shulaâ€™s restaurant in the hotel each morning. A woman makes great omelettes to order, but approach her gently â€“ she was the only person we encountered who did not have a welcoming , service-oriented demeanor. We highly recommend the J W Marriott to anyone visiting New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: MissMarried
Reviews.Content: The JW New Orleans isn't the most grand hotel in the city, but it works. The location can't be beat if you are looking for easy access to Bourbon street. It's just a few blocks away from the action, but is still far enough away that you can get away from the Bourbon street craziness if you need to. Also within walking distance from the aquarium and the casino. The staff was friendly. Concierge was a little hard to get an appointment with. We were looking to plan a day trip to the swamps and every time we walked the desk she was either with someone or has a sign up that she was "returning soon." I called and left a message and never had my call returned. We ended paying a visit to the visitors center in Jackson Square to book our tour and were very happy with their service. Beds were very comfortable with plush linens, but the decor left a bit to be desired. Beautiful gym. Nice rooftop pool, but tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Right Off of Bourbon, Near Everything!!!”
Reviews.Author: debijo61
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a number of times and love the location and the large rooms. I have ALWAYS been upgraded to a corner room, which is quite large and looks out over Canal. The rooms are clean and the beds are so so comfy with down comforters and tons of pillows. The waitstaff is excellent. I had to ship boxes home after Mardi Gras and they brought me empty Fed Ex boxes, then came to my room to pick them up when they were ready. The restuarant is good but pricey. Stayed in one n ight and ordered burgers, they were very good, although I'd much prefer the seafood than a burger (that night we were tired). They have fruit and either hot cider or lemonade out at all times for guests. The business center is merely a table with a computer (no chair) right in the lobby. The one complaint I do have is that one night during Mardi Gras there was a "working girl" sitting in the lobby/lounge area for a couple of hours. I watched her take a man to a room, come back 30 minutes later, and plant herself in the chair again waiting for another "friend". This was quite disgusting to me. I am surprised they let her stay there for as long as they did but no one said anything. We needed key cards to get in the hotel, so either she was staying there or she somehow got in without a key. Other than that one issue I love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great location.”
Reviews.Author: loricr
Reviews.Content: Right on Canal Street and walking distance to everything! We stayed at this hotel for four nights and really enjoyed every minute. Friendly staff, clean and comfortable rooms, good food. Would definitely recommend this hotel if you are looking for something near the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Just another Marriott”
Reviews.Author: SalfromIL
Reviews.Content: Marriott's are business hotels. We stayed at this one because of its location. We got a corner room which was a bit bigger than average. Everything was clean, it had a good location on Canal St and a comfortable bed. But of course there was no personality at all. We were charged $15 a day for internet because they cater to business. Ridiculous if you ask me. One day our room wasn't made up, so we just got more towels from the maid. I wasn't expecting much out of the ordinary and I wasn't surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but has argumentative Room Service people”
Reviews.Author: Jemimagold
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the JW Marriott on in New Orleans the weekend of April 9-11. The main reason we stayed here was that my husband has a lot of Marriott points so we were able to get a free room for both nights. Here are some highlights/lowlights: 1. Room- Our room was clean and well-furnished however it was small and had 5 sides, but 2 of the walls had large windows overlooking the French Quarter so that lessened the feeling of claustrophobia 2. Internet Fee- As other reviewers have noted, $12.50/day is excessive for internet access. My husband has Marriott Platinum Elite status and they wouldn't agree to waive this charge for him so it is safe to assume that everyone has to pay this much. 3. Fitness Facility - There is a decent sized gym however: a) it is very warm with little ventilation and b) it was full both mornings we went (9 am) so be prepared. Also the TV on my treadmill didnâ€™t work. 4. Sassy Room Service People- We ordered breakfast from room service both mornings. The first morning our order was perfect, however the second morning they made some mistakes (even though we had ordered the same things as the day before). When we called them to ask them to rectify the errors, the Room Service lady on the phone was argumentative and wanted to go on and on about why she sent the order the way she did. Regardless, it was wrong and no one wants to spend their time or vacation arguing w/ Room Service. Just fix it and be done, people! 5. Location- The hotel is on Canal St. which means that it borders the French Quarter (but is not in it) which can be a good or bad thing, depending on your view. 6. Parking - We did not have a car but if you are planning to bring one to the hotel, call to ask about parking charges in advance as they can run as high as $30/day in that area. Also, ask the hotel about parking garages in the area which charge less. They will not come out and offer this infor but they tell you if you ask. 7. Concierge Level - Since my husband is a Marriott Plat. Elite, when he booked the room, they said that we would have access to their Concierge Lounge (free food and drink - yay!). We went there to have a drink around 5 pm on Friday after checking in, it was closed. Sadly, according to their sign, the Concierge Lounge is closed during the weekend. . All in all, the JW Marriott was a pleasant enough place to stay since it was free. However, at their rack rates of $250/night, I wouldn't pay money to stay there. I like a bit of style and would probably rather stay at the Omni or W French Quarter instead.

Reviews.Title: “$12.50 per day for internet is like paying extra for carry-on baggage”
Reviews.Author: 2auroras
Reviews.Content: OVerall a fine stay, very convient for visiting the French Quarter and the River Walk, no complaints. It just chaps me that they charge you $200 for a room and then tack on $12.50 every 24 hours to hook up to the hotel ethernet. Just wanted to check a few emails so went to the business center to find all computers require a credit card for internet access at .99 cents a minute. Even your lowest grade two star hotel these days has free internet.

Reviews.Title: “convenient and courteous”
Reviews.Author: CranMass
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the JW Marriott for 5 nights while working a trade show at the convention center. It's location was very convenient to the French Quarter's restaurants and night life. It's a 10 minute walk to the convention center, which was great in the morning but a bit tiring after an 8 hour stint standing in a trade booth. Upon checking in (3pm), I was told my room was not ready due to an NCAA basketball team checking out late. The hotel provided free soft and alcoholic beverages in the lounge as well as appetizers and seafood gumbo. They also credited me with a free movie. All in all I felt they went above and beyond to rectify the situation. The room was standard issue. Clean and relatively new. If you are looking for a "charming" or historic hotel, this is probably not your best choice in New Orleans, but it's nice, everything you'd expect and dependable. On the second night I could not get the temperature above 65 degrees. I called the desk and within 10 minutes maintenance arrived and ended up having replace the unit which they had completed before I returned from dinner. Again, problem fixed quickly and efficiently. The concierge and bell staff was great as well. I would definitely stay at the JWM again for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Mardis Gras”
Reviews.Author: namila
Reviews.Content: A group of friends and I blocked off rooms and went for Mardis Gras. The hotel was in a great location and did what it could to keep things calm at the hotel with the mayhem outside.
