Overall, it was fine for the experience although I probably won't go back when there are other, nicer hotels in the area (see my other review on The Ritz). I would like to say that it may not be a fair review since I'm sure the hotel had their hands full that week (in terms of the cleanliness, service and sleep quality categories).

Reviews.Title: “A little grossed out”
Reviews.Author: lawdogs1
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent business traveler. I have stayed in a lot of places over the years. As a Marriott rewards member, I try to stay at Marriotts when I travel for work. This property was below my expectationsa for a J.W. Marriott. While the bedding was clean and comfortable, and the staff - as always -pleasant and helpful, the room left much to be desired. Once you step into the hallways, it appears that a few too many Mardi Gras revelers had bunked here, kind of tired - dingy, and in sore need of an update. But one thing that I really cannot tolerate is a cleaniness issue. The shower had mold in the grout, carpet threadbare with alot of lint and God knows what else under the door jams. Yuck. I would think a hotel of this calibre would regrout at routine intervals. Way below my expectations. I cant think of a single reason I would stay in a place that has mold in their showers for 200.00 a night again. There wasnt enough good here to make up for it - and there are far nicer places in the city. Kudos to the staff however - I always find the Marriott staff to be a delight. And the concierge lounge was okay - just okay.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impresses by this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jgsc30
Reviews.Content: Location was very good, but I found some of the staff to be rude. When you asked them to do something, it was with an attitude. Concierge and front desk in particular. Rooms were never cleaned until after 3:00pm. We had to call down everyday for the room to be made up. Air Conditioning was not great either. Spa was excellent. Its in the lobby but not associated with the hotel. Ask for Claudia. She was excellent !!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Marriott Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: lazarodp
Reviews.Content: I had guaranteed reservations for a Deluxe Corner room. The desk clerk sent us to a standard handicapped room without telling us a thing. When we called the desk she said the hotel was overbooked and no deluxe rooms were available. She offered to put us up at a nearby hotel. After we indicated this was not acceptable, they magically found a deluxe room. We shared the floor with a college basketball team that was in town for a tournament (not the most quiet place for a peaceful night sleep). After we got home we received a revised bill with $19 of minibar charges even though the minibar was sealed when we arrived and we left it that way. I've been a Marriott customer for over 30 years and they won't see me at this property ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: itspatty
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we wanted to be close to the French Quarter, but not too close as we were travelling with kids and were concerned about the noise level. In that respect the hotel totally lived up to our expectations. The rooms were nice and we still felt connected to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Staff - Guest Rooms need Updating”
Reviews.Author: GeauxSaintsGeaux
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Superbowl weekend. From checkin to checkout, all staff members were very accomodating and had a great attitude. You cannot beat the location of this hotel - it's located at the heart of Canal Street, just a block from the French Quarter. The streetcar lines on Canal and St. Cahrles are easily accessed. There are a ton of restaurants within walking distance, as well as a nice one inside the hotel. (Shula's steakhouse). There's also an expansive bar and lounge area just adjacent to the restaurant. For day drinks or evening cocktails, you can visit the main bar and lounge area close to the lobby of the hotel. The area can accomodate a large amount of people and you can also order food from the hotel menu. The Guest rooms were just ok, very clean, but a butoverpriced for what you get. For $200 a night you get a "Deluxe" room, which is quite small. I called ahead to make sure that the room I chose would have a decent size flat panel LCDTV in case we watched the big game in the room. Unfortunately, the rooms only had a 26" older tube TVs. Maybe it's just me, but I think any moderm 4-star hotel should have nice flat panel LCD TVs. Lesser hotels have made this leap. Also, the rooms we were in lacked a certain cohesiveness - the decor was strange - nice modern bedding, then an ugly brass lamp, then a nice New Orleans-themed picture, followed by a out-of-place themed picture with ugly framing. The TV armoir/dresser was tasteless in design and hideously large, it took up entirely too much space and was an eye sore. The room wasn't all bad, the did provide a few small extras such as a alarm clock-radio with a docking station for an iPod, which we actually used. There was a writing desk and chair, as well as two oversized chairs. I may be splitting too many hairs, but when you spend $200+/night, you notice these things. All in all, the hotel was nice and friendly, I just think the rooms could use some updating with attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Great Views”
Reviews.Author: mr_expresso_king
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to give some info about the Hotel. I stayed for almost 3 months (traveled home each weekend). Location is great (right on Canal Street). Parking is valet and isn't cheap but there is a self park about a block away. Hotel is very good. Rooms are very nice - room service was great. Menu was ok but staff were always nice and followed up with phone calls afterwards for feedback. Checking in/out was easy. Just an FYI for those travelers leaving on Thursday call downstairs to the valet early to get your car. It can get backed up. If you don't need a car then there are plenty of cabs to take you to and from the airport and also around town. Bourbon Street is fun and definitely need to see once. The French Quarter was great and has some great restaurants. Don't forget the Garden District either. Everyone is friendly - if you go during the summertime just remember that's hot - really hot and humid. Back to the hotel - Shulu's is overrated and there are plenty of other places to go (just ask the front desk - many within walking distance). Lastly - great workout room - cardio and weights are split in different rooms with the pools adjacent to the gym. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the JW”
Reviews.Author: CaitlinK
Reviews.Content: I'm a frequent visitor to New Orleans, and this is my first stay at the JW. The location is fantastic, pretty close to all the touristy stuff you'd want to do. The rooms are clean and comfortable, the property itself is pretty nice overall. The check-in area was a little weird...kinda small. The pool area was also a little disappointing. The quality of the room makes up for the not-so-quality pool though.

Reviews.Title: “Biggest and baddest skyrise hotel in Nawlins!”
Reviews.Author: willis_w
Reviews.Content: If you are staying in a big hotel this is THE one to stay at. However for the asking price walk-ins get would be able to do better with a different place locally. Looking online will find a rate thats criminal considering how nice everything is there. They have exacting quality measures and if you stay there I'm sure you'll agree. It's also a very safe hotel... which is important if you don't know the area.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel for its location”
Reviews.Author: edswife
Reviews.Content: We had a corner king room with a great view. It was just far enough removed from the French Quarter to be quiet and peaceful. However, it was only a matter of crossing the street to be right in the thick of everything. The room was beautiful, the bed comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location - avoid hotel bar & Shula's restaurant though”
Reviews.Author: ETJT
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for a week in January. The hotel is clean and comfortable, and in a very good location close to the French quarter. The reception staff, concierge and bell boys were friendly and helpful, perhaps they could educate the bar staff to be the same. The bar was cold and totally lacking in atmosphere - and the barmaid gave us the impression that we were being a nuisance by ordering drinks at all! Shula's restaurant was a huge disappointment! The food was slightly less than mediocre with no presentation at all - the service was appalling and the whole thing was ridiculously overpriced. There are wonderful restaurants all around - so my advice would be to avoid Shula's completely. Overall this is a pleasant hotel in a prime location, where we got an excellent deal on the internet - so don't pay the rack rate.

Reviews.Title: “JW Marriott NOLA”
Reviews.Author: ddlembo
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. Right by Bourbon Street and close to the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: brideinmex
Reviews.Content: My expectations for JW Marriott Properties must be too high! Our 2 night stay (which we shortened from 3 nights) was very bad. The room was unclean, the trash cans had not been emptied, there were no towels in our room when we checked in...the heat was not working properly and we happened to be there during a cold spell. NOT a good experience. I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone. My business partner has allergies and the customer service was awful when we tried to get a "non" down pillow for her. As a long time rewards member I was very disappointed in our stay. The exterior doesn't event look like the online photos and it was much farther from the convention center than we were lead to believe. We were with a group at the convention center and could have stayed at one of their group rate hotels but as a Marriott rewards member I thought we would have much nicer accommodations if we stayed at a JW Marriott. The property in general needs some TLC. The bathroom was tiny and cramped and the wall outside our room was banged up and scuffed. Not impressed at all!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: citychick76
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend trip. Arrived 2 hours early and we were able to check in right away. The desk clerk was very nice and helpful. We were very happy with our room. It had all the amenities that a person would need- iron, hairdryer, safe, boutique toiletries. The bed was very comfortable- feather bed overlay and high count sheets. The rooms were very clean and the housekeeping staff efficiently cleaned our rooms daily. The hotel is located CBD a block from Bourbon St- easy to walk to the French Quarter. A trolley stop is less then a block away and and inexpensive ($1.25 one way) way to get to the Garden District. The only negative- the hotel room doors close loudly- so you can hear other guests doors slam shut when they leave their room. Seems like this is a combination of poorly made doors and inconsiderate guests. Other than the hallway noise, the rooms were pretty well insulated- while I could hear our neighbor putting things away in his/her closet, I didn't hear any tvs or conversations from the next door rooms. I didn't use the room service, gym or hotel restaurant or bar, so I can't make an comments. This is a great place if you are looking for a reasonable priced hotel that is clean and close to city sites.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay at this Marriott again”
Reviews.Author: brenttcumbaa
Reviews.Content: First let me start by saying that we had a wonderful time in New Orleans. We were going to do that no matter what. When we called after arriving in the area near the hotel earlier than expected my wife called about early check-in and where we should park. We were told to drive around to the back of the hotel where we were greeted with no self-parking garage, but a $35 dollar a day valet parking option only. There was no early check-in but the staff was wonderful and took our things to a storage are while we went out for lunch. A few hours later we went to check into our room. Still no room available NEARLY 1 1/2 HOURS after our scheduled check-in time. The staff again was very nice and we were given a 25 dollar certificate to be used in the hotel restaurant. 30 minutes later we still had no room, so we sat in the lobby and waited for some sign that a room that I had paid good money for would become available. When we did get a room I tried to get online to download a map to be better oriented. WIRED INTERNET COSTS $14.95 PER DAY. Most economy hotels offer their guests at least free wired internet. Once again the STAFF IS GREAT at this hotel. However if management is not able to budget how much time is needed to clean and ready a room for this next guest then they should be in a new line of work. I was overall disappointed since I have had more professional experiences with hotels like La Quinta and Econolodge than this so-called "better" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: BarCleveland
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before visiting New Orleans, including checking out many hotels. TripAdvisor was one of my sources. Thankfully, I selected the J.W. Marriott because it was a thoroughly delightful experience from the front desk, to the concierge, to room service, the incredibly comfortable bed, other amenities, the beautifully decorated lobby areas, ideal location for walking to the French Quarter, Harrah's, the bus and the streetcar. I did not use the pool or gym, but both areas were impressive - pristine. Oh, okay, I do have 1 criticism. The walls 'are' very thin. Fortunately, I had good neighbors on the 26th floor because had I not, it could have been miserable. (Doesn't make sense that a hotel would not use soundproofing in the construction - or at least in upgrading a place where many people spend time there trying to sleep). But, again, my experience was great. Paper thin walls seem to be a common complaint in reviews of hotels in New Orleans. The J.W. should be high on your list of places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Luck-o-the-Brirish
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at the JW Marriott and was very pleased with my stay. The hotel is perfectly located between the French Quarter and the Central business district so exploring the city on foot is very convenient. My room was spacious, clean and nicely appointed. The gym was well equipted with both cardio and free weights. I found the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful (not always the case in NOLA). I will definately stay at the JW Marriott on future visits to the Crescent City and would recommend this property without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: afortunatelife
Reviews.Content: We had a great long weekend in New Orleans and the location of the JW was perfect. Our room had a very nice view of Canal St. and the French Quarter. Two different streetcars stop within a block of the hotel. It's the perfect location to explore the Garden District, CBD, French Quarter, riverfront, and lots more. Plus, there are a CVS and Walgreens right outside for all those traveling necessities. Our room was clean and comfortable each day. We had limited interaction with the staff but they were very friendly and helpful. We didn't try the restaurant - just too many other great options nearby tempting us. The coffee and tea were restocked daily but I wish we had regular mugs instead of just paper cups in the room. I appreciate the two small bottles of water free each day, in addition to the optional $5 bottle. Two complaints: a few times the shower seemed to be short on hot water. Not ice cold, but there was definitely something not right. I didn't mention it to the staff because it only happened a few times and wasn't too bad. Second, there is a charge to use anything at all in the business center. You can't even hop online to check your email for free! We needed to pay online for a walking tour and were really irritated to find it would cost us a few dollars for 10 minutes of interet access plus a charge for printing. We called and paid the $4 processing fee to the tour company for a phone transaction instead. We'll probably try a boutique French Quarter hotel next time, but if you're new to New Orleans and want something centrally located and easy, this is a good bet.

Reviews.Title: “Two commendations and a criticism”
Reviews.Author: museumgoer
Reviews.Content: We're from Baton Rouge and occasionally stay overnight in New Orleans. This would not be one of our top choices, but we were meeting a relative who gets a huge discount at Marriotts. Our room was fine and we encountered no problems except one: it was raining hard, there was no umbrella in the room, and the front desk ran out of umbrellas. I think heavy rain is foreseeable in New Orleans, as is the desire of guests to walk , and it is inexcusable to fail to provide an umbrella to every guest who needs one. On the other hand: (1) the lady whose job it was to hail taxis Saturday night December 12 around 7:00 did a terrific job under very difficult circumstances, and (2) a uniformed staffer named Selassie ( I think that's his name) went out of his way to be helpful on two separate occasions. I don't know what his job is, but he certainly seems eager to deal with whatever has to be dealt with and get it done.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to the Marriott standard - poor design & security”
Reviews.Author: lietuva_9
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the better part of a week. This hotel has a good location but the design of the lobby and the room is peculiar. As another traveler has noted, the car lobby is down a small side street and opens into the reception desk. However, reception has no view of the elevators and so anyone can get into the elevators and up into the guest floors. The room is large enough (we were in one of the wedge-shaped rooms) but the light switches are placed in exactly the wrong locations - you have to be well into the dressing and the sink rooms in order to find the light switch. No exhaust fan in the room means poor ventilation and odor control. The HVAC system was poorly balanced and noisy. I had to run water for five minutes to get hot water up to our floor. It's strange also that while Marriott has a "green" policy of asking the guest to direct the laundry of towels and so on, the maids routinely remove nearly full bottles of shampoo and conditioner and take away soap! While we understand that the concierge lounge is meant for the business traveler it would be nice if it were opened on weekends. It is a constant annoyance to us (and we stay in Marriott properties a lot) that the upper-end properties expect their guests to pay for Internet access while guests in lower-end properties have it included. It was very annoying to have to go to the concierge lounge or the lobby for internet access, and when the hotel was inundated with uncontrollable (and uncontrolled) Grambling fans during the Bayou Classic, the lobby was not an option at all. We had a lot of noise and disruption from these other guests during our stay and it was evident that the hotel couldn't cope with it. We were "comped" breakfast in the Shula restaurant for Thanksgiving morning, since the concierge lounge was closed, and the service and food there was mediocre at best. Tea was lukewarm, omelets were poorly cooked, and service was disjointed.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Cincinnatus1
Reviews.Content: Overall: This is my first stay at at JW Marriott (2 nights). It's a very nice hotel, though it does not seem to be a huge upgrade from a regular Marriott. The location is excellent. Room: Very comfortable. Nice bedding. Flat screen TV (though wasted on an analog signal). Clean and quiet. Internet is an extra charge. Location: Great location - directly across Canal St. from the French Quarter. 10 minute walk down to the river. One block to the St. Charles streetcar stop to the Garden District. This is a great place from which to explore New Orleans. Services: There is a nice fitness center and an outdoor pool on the roof. The concierge was very helpful. Value: I used Priceline, so the hotel was definitely a great value for me. If paying regular rates, this hotel would probably be about average value.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay At JW”
Reviews.Author: PeghandleMike
Reviews.Content: Everything you would expect of a hotel of this class. We stayed here November 14th for a weekend getaway and everything went like clockwork. This was our 3rd stay at the JW and never had any major problems. Check In was prompt and courteous. We were even able to check in early at 11am at no additional charge. The room was nice and clean and included a great city view.( Which is epecially beautiful when lit up in the evening). However,there seems to have been a LACK OF HOT water in the shower. (Lukewarm at best) The room was exceptionally quite. We have been to other hotels in NO where the walls between rooms are quite thin and hallways filled with late night revelers. No problem here. Parking is $32 which is par for New Orleans. The valet was prompt and had our vehicle waiting for us! Elsewhere, in New Orleans you call the valet wait 10 minutes in your room and when go downstair and try to retrieve your vehicle it's still not ready. The location is actually perfect. The French Quarter is directly across the street with Bourbon St closeby. You can party all night in the Quarter then cross the street to your quite hotel room No blaring music ,no drunks,nada. Directly behing the Hotel is the " business district" but there are great restaurants and bars in that area also.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, so-so maid service and missing concierge”
Reviews.Author: sandlovers
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff are nice. The bell staff are superb. We had two rooms for 4 nights. Two nights I came back to wash my hair and take a shower and had no shampoo in my room. To me, at a hotel of this quality, there is no excuse for this. By this point, the solved my problem by bringing me a bag of 5 shampoos. The concierge was basically non-existent. When I travel for pleasure, I am accustom to using the service of the concierge. There was a note continually to go to the front desk for questions. I did see someone at the desk the morning we were leaving and we did make our reservations on our own. There were no brochures available for us to look at so it was a hassel for us to continue to stand in line at the front desk while people were checking in to inquire about certain attractions to have them track down a brochure etc. I just don't expect this at a JW Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Poor security would question it's safety.”
Reviews.Author: Almond66
Reviews.Content: I travel to New Orleans frequently. I often priceline my hotel if it's just for a one night stay. I was placed in the JW on this trip. It was my fault for not checking but i did confuse it with the original Marriott on Canal street nearer to the River. I went there first and they were very helpful in redirecting me to the JW which is also on Canal. They gave me clear instructions as to where to turn to get to the front entrance which is in the back and not on Canal. I had flown in and gone out with friends prior to checking in. It was about 1130 when I arrived at the JW. It seemed like the right place, the auto entrance is on the back of the hotel in a more isolated back street. There was no one around except for someone who could have been a street person sitting on a bench. (I wasn't going to give them my car.) I waited for about 15 minutes and no one arrived. There seemed to be no activity in the lobby making me question whether I had pulled up to the right place. I circled the block and couldn't find another entrance except for the one fronting canal. I left the car and walked in, (as a single woman a little disconcerting as it was late and NOONE was around. I walked to what should be the front desk and noone came out. Questioning if there was another front desk, I walked into the hotel and to the first floor. Again noone. I came out to the lobby again and then saw someone. He told me that this was the front desk and he was just a guest so couldn't tell me more. I waited for a while, and probably 15 minutes later someone came out. I assumed he was the front desk clerk. He didn't tell me who he was but later I realized he was a security guard. He then called someone and another 5 to 10 minutes later the front desk clerk came out. He then called the valet who also wasn't where he should be, and had my car parked. This was 45 minutes after I initially pulled in. Although this is poor service, what was MOST concerning was no one was watching their front lobby. Anyone or any group of people could have just wandered in. In addition, there was not one apology for the whole experience when I explained what happened in a very calm manner. The next day I let a manager know, who seemed a bit responsive but I really didn't get the sense that anyone realized how dangerous a situation they potentially had. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. I'm not afraid of New Orleans as a city but you have to be careful as anywhere. This hotel has to get a better group of people at night and execute whatever security plan they have.

Reviews.Title: “It's a great location and pretty good deal”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryTraveler07
Reviews.Content: Went to NOLA for a week Oct 20-25/09. Great City! Great fun - hotel was pretty good but just a few minor details they could work on and it would be just perfect. They need to vaccum their rooms a little more frequently and thoroughly. We upgraded to a plush bed that was great, the room location was good and the room size was definitely adequate. Sometimes housekeeping gave us water (bottled) and some days not. There is an in room coffee maker that is quite convenient. We did get an mini bar charge of six dollars when we checked out - which was an error - but at 5:00 am check out - it was a minor error and we could not be bothered arguing. Didn't use any of the ammenities (pool/salon/restaurant) as there are sooo many wonderful places to eat in NOLA (like NOLA!). Service is friendly just about everywhere. Everyone on the street greets you all day long, no matter where you're at. The hotel is block away from an IHOP - which comes in handy if you're looking to eat big and walk it off! Which is what you'll do. I recommend the walk through the Garden District - take the street car from St. Charles to Jackson and get off and walk around the beautiful homes. Walk back to the hotel - not too far (as long as you are comfortable walking and able) the cobblestones and some of the brick walks get to be a bit ankle wrenching. Walk along the Mississippi and take the Natchez steam boat - one evening ate at K-Paul's - good food - rich - but service is very cool compared to NOLA (Emeril Lagasse's) where you are actually "waited" upon - make reservations for both before going - they are very busy. Dress is pretty casual for most places or you can dress up if you like. Bourbon street is close to the hotel and is just unbelievable until you see if for yourself. Really nice antique shops if you like that thing close by. Shopping is a little sparse but oh well! Like I said there are some great restaurants all over to pick from - don't limit yourself if you can. The pralines are great everywhere! Didn't do Cafe du Monde because it was always busy and didn't want to wait in line. Really like NOLA and would go back to visit anytime. Great city, great people and JW Marriott hotel is pretty good for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Staff Very Conducive to Business in the Downtown Area”
Reviews.Author: SalesKing
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for an industry conference that took place this past weekend. It's a wonderful hotel, beautiful, extraordinary staff who are very helpful in every way. They know you by name which shows outstanding training. I will go to this hotel again. There were concerns however. At such an expensive hotel I was surprised to realize that there was no free internet in the rooms; it was $14.95 per day. Additionally, in the fitness center the bench press machine was broken (the foundation to a man's workout) during my entire stay. And finally, just across the Don Shula Restaurant which is excellent there are display windows with sample bottles of wine and one that reads "Reserved for Don Shula" that is filthy. It even had cobwebs. Someone just needs to clean it. Overall however this is a great hotel in which I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: addicted2cruizin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for three nights. The room was perfect. From the 28th floor, we could see the river and French Quarter. I was disappointed my room did not have a hairdryer. The concierge was very helpful with directions and booking tours. We will stay here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Room”
Reviews.Author: BlueDart404
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend. First visit to New Orleans. While this wasn't a bad hotel, I don't really think it was worthy of the "JW" label. It seemed more in line with the regular Marriott brand. Although the hotel's address is on Canal Street, the actual entrance for parking is off of Common Street, one block behind Canal. The lobby is actually fairly impressive - very modern looking, and check in was quick and easy. We were given a corner room on the 28th level. The room was a decent size - larger than a regular room, at least - but it left something to be desired. The furnishings were old and could stand to be updated. The bed, while not uncomfortable, was nothing special. I don't know if it was the standard Marriott bed. The flat screen TV was nice, but there was one time where we turned it on and the majority of the channels weren't working. The bathroom was a bit on the small side. One evening when we were showering before heading out, the hot water didn't work. Condensation from the air conditioner dripped from the ceiling continuously. To Marriott's credit, they gave me some bonus points and offered to change our room due to A/C and no hot water problems. We kept this room since we were checking out the next day. The concierge lounge was closed over the weekend (no surprise, but still not cool). The in guest service directory was missing several pages, including room service menus. When we called late one night to find out what they had and place an order, we were told they only had two late night offerings, neither of which we wanted. Surprising and disappointing that a "high end" hotel in such a large tourist destination doesn't offer 24 hour room service. The best thing about this hotel its location. You aren't immediately in the French Quarter, but all you have to do is cross Canal St, and you're there. The staff was generally helpful and nice. Shula's Restaurant was great for the breakfast buffet and getting a quick drink before heading out to the Quarter. Also close by are the casino, Canal Place shops, aquarium, and other downtown attractions. I'd stay here again for the right price, but will probably want to check out something else on my next visit to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “JW Marriott New Orleans - Relaxation, Convenience, and a GREAT View!”
Reviews.Author: HotelJunky84
Reviews.Content: I have had the opportunity to stay at the JW Marriott on numerous occaisions throughout the past couple of years and the hotel has always exceeded my expectations. Originally, this hotel was a Le Meridien that converted to the JW Marriott flag - so expect a great hotel experience with excellent service. Location! Location! Location! If you have ever been to New Orleans, then you know how important location is. If your goal is to hang out at the clubs on Bourbon Street during the night or shop for antiques on Royal Street during the day, you could not ask for a better location! The JW Marriott rises prominently off of Canal Street - seperating the Central Business Disctrict from the French Quarter. You will find it easy to step out the front door of your hotel and enter into the world of America's only European city. Within a few blocks of the hotel are numerous restaurants including the Dickey Brenan's Palace Cafe which is located directly across the street. Overall, this is an excellent location that combines comfort with safety and security. Public Areas The JW Marriott offers a free flowing floor plan on the main floor of the hotel. If you enter from the Canal Street entrance, you will travel through the arcade area which includes numerous shops and the world famous Shula's Steakhouse. From the arcade, you will find yourself at the hotel's lobby bar which offers bi-level seating but never really seems to entertain too many guests -- which is not unusual considering it is located 2 blocks from Bourbon Street. Continuing along the path, you will find public restrooms and a gorgeous jazz rotunda that depicts the New Orleans music scene through a massive wall painting which carries you into the main lobby. In the main lobby, you will find the concierge, guest elevators and the very attentive front desk. Located on the upper floors, you will find the outdoor pool and fitness center. Unfortunately, the hotel does not offer locker rooms or shower facilities in this area of the hotel. However, they do offer a rinse shower located next to the pool. Rooms! The rooms at the JW Marriott are typical of an upper class Marriott hotel and offer excellent views of the French Quarter or downtown if you are able to get a room located on any floor above 15. While classically styled, the furniture in the rooms could use a bit of updating but this is not a major downfall of the hotel. If you enjoy comfy beds that feel like sleeping on clouds --- then this is the hotel for you! I would have to say that the major con of the rooms at the JW Marriott is that the bathrooms tend to be a bit on the small side and makes for a cramped situation if more than one person is trying to use the mirror at the time. Overall I highly recommend the JW Marriott New Orleans to anyone who is traveling to the city and would like to treat themselves to a luxury hotel that offers convenience and safety. As a person who travels to New Orleans on a monthly basis, I can honestly say that this is 1 of 10 properties that I would probably recommend for your upcoming trips.

Reviews.Title: “This is a JW???”
Reviews.Author: ChocolateAnything
Reviews.Content: We went to New Orleans for a cousin's wedding, and traveled with our 2 year old. I was excited that the branding was a JW Marriott, the highest end of the Marriott chain. However, it was less than glorious in person. The lobby was modern with an interesting frosted glass pillar with changing colored lights, which entertained my kid during check-in. But when you looked up at the ceiling, there was such bad water damage (from Katrina, no doubt). The service was fine and attentive. We had the corner concierge level room which was not as spacious as I thought it would be. The decor was very old and dated, which was absolutely surprising that this was a JW. There was a large LCD TV, but the channels were sparse and none of the channels were in HD (not taking advantage of the TV). Then again, none of the hotels ever do. Our bed was satisfactory, nothing that I'd rave about. The view was nice. We did love the ipod dock. The bathroom was very small and outdated as well. It was difficult to wash my little girl in the tub because it was so dark in the bathroom. The pool was teeny tiny and closed the first day we were there. They offered us to use the Marriott Hotel pool across the street, but it seemed like too much to do just for a short swim. On the day that the pool was open, the water was freezing cold, which again, surprising as a JW hotel. We dipped our toes in and that was it. Breakfast at the downstairs restaurant - Shula's - was our highlight. Starbucks coffee, delicious and plentiful variety of buffet foods, hot and cold. We had great service as well. The morning that we had to catch our flight, they allowed us to make a take-out package to eat on the run. The location was decent and away from all of the nightly noise. We walked everywhere. My little girl's favorite was the aquarium, which I thought it was very child-friendly. I would recommend this hotel if you can get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: vvwalker
Reviews.Content: We were in NO to celebrate my husband's birthday. I got a great deal on priceline.com for this hotel. Check in was a breeze and not once were we made to feel 'uncomfortable' for paying only $46 per night at this nice hotel. We loved everything about it. It is conveniently located across from the French Quarter and right on the St. Charles street car line. We also walked to Harrah's easily. The beds are so comfy with white bedding, soft pillows and down duvet. The rooftop pool was nice and the fitness center offers free fresh fruit and bottle water. Room service was delivered promptly and was delicious - they even called to see how everything was. I would definitely choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great everything!”
Reviews.Author: karol_monteiro
Reviews.Content: Perfect getaway place. I got a great deal on this awesome hotel, so it made everything even better. Very close to Bourbon St for night life, safe to walk around. Also recommend Mother's restaurant few blocks away. The rooms was amazing,clean, comfortable, and even a little view of the river! I love the French Quarter, and love this hotel. Parking can be a little expensive, but you know your car will be safe!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: pinzonero
Reviews.Content: My experience at this hotel was the best. The location is perfect, their advices were the best , and Christina ( the manager) and Kim ( agent at night) made our stay memorable. Breakfast buffett is very complete, amenities are high end.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for Mardi Grass”
Reviews.Author: favargas
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great very nice, they gave us a room in the top floor and I was able to see the area from there, across from the french quarter, we were able to carry drinks from the hotel into the street and back to the room. the staff was friendly and it is a relatively short drive from the airport. Walking distance to the casino. The only bad thing was the Shula's steakhouse not really worth it for the price we paid!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy”
Reviews.Author: Ebuzzm
Reviews.Content: Great Location, with all the Ameneties you need. Pool was reall nice and required for the hot weather. I could not find any good pics before I went so I uploaded some.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ok room for 4 star”
Reviews.Author: msukevtrip
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights, booked the room through Priceline for $46 a night. I'm not sure if hotels have select "Priceline" rooms that are lower quality, but i did notice the key card insert part of the door more worn down than the other rooms around me. I did see some grout that could be repaired in the bathroom and a few ants crawling around, but nothing of any trouble. Given that it was the top of the line of Marriott, I guess I expected close to perfection. Overall the room was in good solid livable condition, though it was a bit small. We did have an issue with the television and it's reception, there were a few nights that the satellite reception could not receive a signal on most stations, it was especially bad during a small rain storm. The room was really nice to stay in, but I would not call it luxurious. Entering the lobby floor was very impressive looking (also had great lemonade), but the rooms did not carry that glamor. The exercise room was quite large and gave free mini water bottles and complementary towels for the pool. The pool was a little smaller than expected. The staff was typical and friendly, didn't really interact with them. The location is across the street from the French Quarters, so it was very walkable to anywhere we wanted to go. It was a great location for not being in the French Quarters. Overall, it was a great stay, and especially for only $46 a night, it was a great deal. I don't think I would pay full price to stay here though.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: AshVirginia
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights, August 13 to August 16, at the JW in New Orleans. We loved our stay at the hotel. We were received warmly and were assinged a room on the twenty second floor overloooking Canal St. The receptionist volantarily showed us the map of the area and said that it was safe to walk around. The room was small but clean including the bath room. There was a safe in the room to keep valuables. I had problem opening it at first but that was fixed quickly. The room was cleaned everyday. There was a box in the room with tea and coffee with a small coffee maker. There were two small water bottles for making the tea/coffee. I found out that one can pick up more small water bottles from the Gym on the eight floor. We went out and bought two bottles before we discoverd this. Melissa at the consierge desk was very pleasant and helpful. She provided us with maps and information about the local entertainment scene and restaurants. We enjoyed the Jaz at the Ritz as played by Jeremy Davenport. This was free. We would not have known that without Mellisa telling us. We booked a trip to the swamp to see alligators. The food at the Bourbon Cafe, Acme, and Cafe Palace was excellent. We did not care much for the Cafe DuMond serving the Frech Donuts. It was crowded and chaotic. We moved around the French Quarters including the market using the maps and information provided by Mellisa. We saw the statue of Ignatius, the main character from the book A Confideracy of Dunces. It was only a couple of blocks from the hotel. Now there is a new restaurant named after Ignatius at 4200 Magazine St. We took the Street Car that was available next door to the hotel. This restaurant is really cool. It is very small but the food was authentic and spicy the way it should be. It is frequented by mostly young crowd. We only had breakfast at the Shula (in JW) on the last day. The buffet breakfast at Marriotts are usually very good. On the whole it was very enjoyable trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at JW”
Reviews.Author: rebel-14
Reviews.Content: We had a group of traveling together for a conference held at the superdome in New Orleans. We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights, and it was great. The hotel was fully booked so it was very busy, but the front desk still helped us with our needs. The concierge was great and very knowledgable with answering our questions-anything from "where should we eat?" to "what is there to do around New Orleans?" She hooked us up with a city tour and a swamp tour which were both great. The rooms were average sized, but very clean and nice. Everything was pretty new. We ordered room service-we got pizza from the hotel's restuaurant Shula's. It was average tasting pizza, and a Large on their menu is comparable to the size of a medium at Dominos. I would reccommend this hotel to most everyone. I would also like to say that the Location is great! It is within walking distance to the riverwalk, convention center, superdome, and bourbon street is 2 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome”
Reviews.Author: dachsun
Reviews.Content: My mother her husband, my husband his father stayed at the JW Marriott on Canal in New Orleans and had a wonderful time. Isabell the concierge was wonderful and very accommodating. My mother birthday was one of the best she has had thanks to the Marriott. Everyone enjoyed the friendly staff and wonderful rooms. The front desk, valet very very helpful with evything that we needed. I will recommend to everyone that I know. Thanks so much. Freda

Reviews.Title: “The Best Christmas Ever”
Reviews.Author: Shawnhowes
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly, the room spectacular, and the location convenient. We had a beautiful Christmas here.

Reviews.Title: “TOP CLASS HOSPITALITY EDGING THE FRENCH QUARTER”
Reviews.Author: AmedeoDenver
Reviews.Content: This hotel is spotless, comfortable with an extremely professional and courteous staff. Location is excellent, just across the street from Bourbon street. There can be noise from the street (we heard drums into the night) depending on room location. Breakfast at the restaurant was not as excellent as you would expect in New Orleans. Overall it's a perfect place for a fund vacation in NOLA. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “not fancy and not a dump - average 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: diggsterny
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott isn't the fanciest of hotels, nor is it the worst of its class. Just steps from a cable car stop that will take you to the Garden District in less than 10 mins, and a quick jog from Cafe Dumont I'd recommend this hotel if you book a room reservation at a heavily discounted rate (e.g. Priceline). Location: Bordering the French Quarter, its location keeps this otherwise outdated hotel at par. Decor: The standard room barely meets the minimum requirements for the typical four star hotel rating. Nothing fancy, something that reminds me of your average business traveler hotel room. Cleanliness: Meets the four star minimum requirements. Staff: Front desk was not very friendly. Concierge was not very knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott You Should Be Ashamed!”
Reviews.Author: TravelHistory
Reviews.Content: I travel for work and pleasure all over the world and I have to say that I was very, very disappointed with the J.W. Marriott hotel on Canal Street. The room charge was $269.00 per night and I had to change rooms three times until they showed me, "one of our new rooms with cherry furniture". When asked why they would rent a room with furniture falling apart, lamps that don't work, dirty carpet, scuffed walls, bathrooms with lavatories at hip height (I am 5' 4" inches) and generally dirty bathrooms, their reply was, "well we are upgrading our rooms and this used to be a Meridian Hotel, so its not our fault". (Just so you know J.W. Marriott has owned the hotel for several years, so its not a new purchase). To make matters worse, the Saturday evening front desk girl was rude and nasty when you checked in, called and asked to switch rooms or ask a general question. To further the horrible stay, the hotel had rented out a large number of rooms to pre teen/teenage girls on a choir tournament. The noise of young girls screaming in their rooms and in the halls until 2:30 a.m. each morning was unbearable! Did hotel staff help? Not much and these girls were chaperoned by middle aged adults! Where were the adult chaperones while the girls ran wild, on Bourbon Street? I recently stayed at a Hotel Intercontinental, which is Holiday Inn's "Ritz Carlton" and their rooms and staff were far superior. In fact, I have stayed in Hampton Inn's and Holiday Inn's that are better than this hotel. Marriott's room service food was marginal, but the wait staff were great. Although trays of food and dirty dishes sat in the hall for 2 to 3 days without being picked up! The Shula restaurant located inside the hotel property was horrible and New Orleans is known for its fabulous food. Try Brennan's Palace Cafe across the street from the hotel, its fabulous. In fact any Brennean's restaurant in New Orleans is fabulous. Trip Advisor members, this is a J.W. Marriott, and is quote the "the Ritz of the Marriott's". If this is the Ritz of Marriott's, save your money and stay in a Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel - Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: FloridaStateNole
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the JW Mariott on Canal during the month of May and was extremely pleased. A room rate of $99 / night was very affordable for the high quality of the room. The location is a great one and within easy walking distance to many excellent restaurants and French Quarter attractions. All staff members I met were extremely pleasant and polite. The front desk offered us a room on the concierge suite with a nice view of the French Quarter. The room was very clean and surpassed our expectations. The bed was particularly comfortable with a large, HD flat screen (though not many HD channels). Large bath-tub was a nice feature. The only down-side to our stay was the expensive parking. My wife and I had met and driven separately. The hotel charges $32 per vehicle per night. However, I think this is fairly common in the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Babies first trip to New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: lsumccoy
Reviews.Content: Decided to take our 3 yr old boy and 1 yr old twin girls to the aquariunm and Zoo. Booked a room for two nights. Our trip was a last minute so I booked through priceline. Booked the room on 6-12-09 for the 12th and 13th, a Friday and Saturday. The rooms were clean, beds were comfortable and we were given a playpen and a stroller to use for the weekend free of charge. The Vallet, Bellmen and front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. The location was great for walking to the aquarium and French Quarter. Could not have been happier and the fact that a last minute room was booked for $50.00 a night for a Friday and Saturday in New Orleans was great!! The only negative is the $35.00 a night parking charge.

Reviews.Title: “reasonable price for such a nice hotel... perfect location”
Reviews.Author: EDT_08
Reviews.Content: Situated perfectly between bourbon st. and the casino, the JW is in a great spot. the hotel was very clean. Pool was small but sunny. Nice free gym! Free bottled water at the gym and delivered to your room. My only complaint about the hotel is that there was no wireless service in the rooms paid or unpaid.... there was wired high speed internet but how 90's is that! It amazes me that i can stay at a 2 star days inn and get free wifi but at the higher end places they nickel and dime you over stuff like that. I just don't get it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: tomawok
Reviews.Content: Hight standards in a beautiful hotel right in the middle of the city and close to everything. The breakfast is incredible, there's everything and it taste paradise. The fitness room is big and the all hotel a lot of fun. Staff is so friendly and helpful especially at the breakfast. Book as well by the concierge some trip for a day to get the story of this part history. Hotel is really comfortable and the staff excellent. Recommend 100 %!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not a full price--a disappointing JW. . .”
Reviews.Author: TravelBeard
Reviews.Content: This is a tough review to write, as I had a nice stay--but agree that the hotel has some challenges. Prompted to be concerned given other reviews that complained about dated, small rooms, I called the GM's office before my stay to make sure I avoided getting accommodations I'd not like. Jacqueline Simon in the GM's office was amazing, and note to her boss--she is worth her weight in gold. She listened to my concerned, promised to look into the comments on Trip Advisor, and assured me that my room would be a nice one. She added that she quite liked the rooms in the hotel, but a thorough renovation was planned in the near future. I was so impressed with her--she listened, she owned the problem, she personalized my concerns, and promised she'd take care of it. I was even more impressed at check-in. The front desk had clearly been clued in, and had a 28th floor corner room waiting. The agent who checked me in treated me as I were a VIP, and I received a warm welcome. A great start. Again, kudos to the Front Office Manager. (One off note: I asked the concierge for directions to the Farmers' Market--and she tried to send me to the French Market. . .a different place. When I tried to clarify, she sent me to Magazine and Julia Streets, where the real address is Magazine and Girod, a few blocks away. Since guests seek out a concierge for accurate information, that was a major miss) Nice, well trained staff can be let down by a property in need of repair and updating, though. The lobby has the look of a circa 1992 bank office building, complete with rather cheesy, all-too-corporate looking chandeliers. The hotel hallways were scuffed. And what prompted the adverse reviews of the rooms was apparent, once inside. The hotel tower is unique, in that it is at an angle to the street grid of the city. The layout provides each floor with 8 corner rooms, and these rooms, while a bit larger than standard accommodations, have an odd triangular floorplan. Interestingly, the corner reduces, not increases, the amount of window space of these rooms. These rooms have a king size bed--don't think two doubles would fit. All seems smaller as a result of low ceilings. The bathrooms have a choppy configuration as well. The sink is separate from the room with the toilet and shower/tub. The watercloset itself is all marble, but rather small. Overall, the decor is dated. Wall graphics from the late 80s, early 90s colors and moldings--despite a flat screen and the trademark Marriott beds--these rooms need an update. Now, I should mention that I got this room for $49 per night on Priceline, and as such, this is an amazing deal. The lowest rate on Marriott.com for the same period was $139, and the upgrade made it even a better value--I'll bet that the Marriott employee rate wasn't even as low as $49. All the same, as a guest who's stayed at other JW Marriotts, this hotel would disappoint at full price. In fact, there are other mainline Marriotts that are nicer, and more updated. The Marriott Marquis in Atlanta, where I recently stayed, has a far better room product. The hotel has a nice fitness center that is free to guests--kudos, as hotels who charge for gyms earn the enmity of travelers who try to stay fit when on the road. One of the two ellipticals was out of order, but there were many treadmills and good weights. The outdoor pool is small and disappointing--scarcely bigger than a backyard pool with a rather cramped pool deck that gets more shadow than sunworshipers might like. Things like parking, in-room movies, and internet were quite expensive--$14.95 a day for broadband, and $13.95 for a movie were notably dear--as was $30+ daily parking with tax. The hotel's location is great. Right on Canal Street, and just across from the French Quarter, the hotel's back door is right near St. Charles Avenue for the famed streetcar. The river, Harrah's Casino, Jackson Square, Bourbon Street. . .all is close at hand. At Priceline prices, this hotel is a winner. But most guests don't stay here on $49 rates. Unless you do, you may want to wait until they renovate. When they do, this will be a hotel to consider.

Reviews.Title: “Would I book at a Marriott? Never again”
Reviews.Author: mariettaseller
Reviews.Content: We were booked in advance of our arrival in New Orleans to stay at JW Marriott on Canal Street on 2/14 on the night before our cruise. This is a 4star hotel with good recommendations online as I regularly research hotels, restaurants, etc before we leave home. I had paid and confirmed twice by phoning the front desk during the week to let them know that we would arrive late (approximately midnight). When we arrived at the airport there was a "skeleton crew" working because, we were told, most employees had not shown up to work. We waited a long time for our bags and at 12 a.m. I called the hotel to confirm that we would be leaving the airport shortly. I was very nervous because it was our first trip to New Orleans and we had concerns about our safety there. I was also concerned because it was late at night, we'd been travelling all day, and we just wanted a good nights sleep in a safe section of town at a brand name hotel. The woman who answered the front desk when I called at midnight said "Actually you won't be staying here tonight. We're overbooked." I thought she must be mistaken. She didn't realize I had already booked a room AND paid for it by credit card weeks before. I replied "Oh, I've confirmed and paid for a room. I'm already booked." She said "No Ma'am, we're overbooked. We have no room for you." I told her "But I confirmed my room already. You gave away my room?" She replied "Ma'am, we're overbooked. There are few rooms left in the city. If you take a cab here we can give you a voucher for another hotel and you can walk there. It's not far from here." Walk in a strange area of New Orleans with luggage after travelling 14 hours? At 1 am? To a hotel I know NOTHING about??? Really? I cancelled and requested a refund. As of 2/26 this refund had not been processed. Priceline intervened and refunded my money in full after a dispute was filed. It has been 2 months since our trip. Since then, Marriott had the administrative assistant to the general manager of the JW Marriott in New rRleans contact us by phone to explain the policy. We weren't available by phone to discuss the policies due to our busy lives. However, after several emails back and forth, the resolution Marriott has offered us is that they reserve the right, per their policy, to rebook your reservation to another hotel with whom they have a relationship. That is IT! It doesn't matter if you've paid. It doesn't matter that you called to confirm twice. You could arrive in a city that is new to you and be told at check in that you are being given a voucher and must relocate to a new hotel. No refund. Nothing complimentary. Not even the cab ride over to the new hotel was offered. Remember that we were advised by check in that it was just a short walk at 1 am with our luggage after 14 hours of travel. Due to this official corporate policy, per the corporate office to my inbox, I would never again recommend Marriott to anyone. While corporate assures me that this is a "rare" occurrence, it seems to me that once is more than we could stomach. If we were just going to take our chances finding any old hotel room when we arrived in town, we certainly wouldn't pre pay and pre schedule a room with them!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: TravelerDrew
Reviews.Content: Wonderful experience. Location is perfect. Rooms and bath rooms are plenty big enough. Bath is spotless. Bedding and towels same. They include robes, coffee service, newspapers and so on. Not sure why anyone would complain about the place. Of course reservations could go wrong, or the Loud family could be staying next door, but clearly the hotel does an outstanding job. The fitness center is better than most with new machines, personal TV sets, free headsets, fruits, water and so on. Impeccably clean and a pleasure to use.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bahnreise
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott in New Orleans has a perfect location in New Orleans. Situated on Canal Street across from the larger Marriott Hotel, The JW Marriott is minutes away from the best sections of the French Quarter. The hotel staff was efficient and friendly. The staff in the Concierge Lounge was considerate and spot with service. We had a corner room on the 27th floor that offered a good view or the French Quarter. The internet was expensive ($14.95/day, including unlimited North American telephone calls). The noises of the hotel (neighboring rooms, including those above and below) seeped through the walls easier than they should. The bed was very comfortable. The room had a large screen TV. Our room was oddly shaped, sort of like a wedge. The air conditioning worked well and was quiet. Housekeeping staff did a good job, but seemed overworked in the fully booked hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet escape from Bourbon Street”
Reviews.Author: momof3FtWright
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at the JW as part of an Expedia package. We had read mixed review online and weren't sure what to expect. We were very pleasantly surprised! Hotel was clean and elegant. Quiet bar in the lobby. Good bar if you want a nice glass of wine before heading off to dinner, but not for Hurricanes and Hand Grenades. Rooms were spacious and decorated nicely. Bathroom a bit cozy. Great workout room! Updated cardio equipment and weight machines. J.W. was the perfect location. Although it was nice being so close to Bourbon Street, we appreciated the chance to settle into our quiet hotel when we had enough.

Reviews.Title: “Good but bland”
Reviews.Author: vthokie91
Reviews.Content: Overall I liked this hotel, the rooms were clean and well appointed. They had full coffee and tea service with bottled water, large fluffy robes and very comfortable beds. The negatives of the room would be a bathroom on the small side and some noise from hotel guests. The work out room had nice, updated equipment with towels, water, fruit and complimentary head sets. Each treadmill had its own television. The drawbacks to this hotel would be the extremely small lobby, I kept thinking, there has to be more. The bar area is in the middle with no real ambiance and their sole restaurant is Donna Shula's steak house. I was looking for some New Orleans character, but I could have been at a bar in Boise, very generic. The location is good, but if you are looking for some local New Orleans flavor, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: kpchitown
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with great staff. My wife and I with my 2 year old son stayed here at the end of February. The hotel is close to everything and the service is excellent. I enjoyed everything about the hotel except the Concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Mediocre at Best”
Reviews.Author: Chicago Flyer
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal for 99/nt via Pricline. Glad I didn't pay full online price which was over 200/nt - certainly wouldn't be worth it. The room was a little run down - wall paper peeling, small bathroom, not very well sound-proofed and could hear people in other rooms and the hallway (we had two rooms on different floors - both the same types of issues). I have been to many lower end hotels that are nicer. The overall decor was dated - if this is a high-end brand for Marriott then they really need to up the game here. Expensive to park. Good points included location (main entrance on Common St but another entrance on Canal on the edge of the French Quarter). Not a noisy location at all but so convenient to the sites. In addition, the elevator was quick - never having to wait). The lobby was small but clean and the staff was friendly. The overall rating of 'poor' is based upon what the hotel tries to bill itself as, not on the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific honeymoon weekend”
Reviews.Author: Lemiracle
Reviews.Content: This was the last stop for our honeymoon trip along the Gulf Coast and they couldn't have taken better care of us. First, the Marriott hotline was helpful in sorting out a complicated issue with my Marriott points, allowing us to get one night for free. Second, I called ahead a few days before with a few special honeymoon-related requests and they happily obliged. They put us in a corner room on one of the top floors, complete with an amazing city view. And I asked the concierge to put a dozen roses in the room, and she did it without hesitation. It looked great. We'd happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, but not all that”
Reviews.Author: junechild
Reviews.Content: Just came back from first trip from new orleans. This hotel is in perfect location on canel st, across from french quarter. If you step outside, you can take street car, and there are few stores for snacks and drinks. The room was not impressive at all. I thought I was at motel 6 or something, and I'm not kidding. I don't know what they're thinking charging $140-190 for that kind of room. Their housekeeping was the worst one yet. I work for airlines, have stayed at many places all over the world. I have to say I was very disappointed choosing this hotel, mad at myself for trusting this brand name without reserching and paying that much for tiny motel quality room. They only have 1 expensive steak restaurant. Who wants to eat "market" price steak when you go to new orleans? The best thing they have is their doorman. They were very friendly and professional. Anyway, I have no problem paying $150-300 for hotel room, but not this one. Pay half price for nearby hotel, it might not be a "big" brand name, but at least you won't be wasting your money

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: ammatlanta
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the JW Marriott for 5 nights for a conference. I have stayed at a JW Marriott before (just Marriott), but was quite pleased with the room. There is a gym (free of charge) which is small but adequate. The location on Canal Street was great and there is an entrance on Canal as well as the main entrance on the street parallel to Canal. As a single female traveler, I felt comfortable and safe with the location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor for a JW Marriott”
Reviews.Author: cliquot
Reviews.Content: Positive: Good location, steps aways from the quarter. Nice lobby. Good service from the door staff and bartenders. That is all the good I can think of. Negative: This just isn't a JW-type hotel. There is no way they should call it one. I have stayed in several JW Marriotts, but this hotel isn't as good as many marriotts that I have stayed at. Poor, noisy plumbing, hot water problems, small and outdated rooms, cheap tv's, indifferent management, poor followthrough, wall outlets that don't work, empty and nonfunctioning mini-bars (after they gave me a key for it?!). I could go on, but trust me, this hotel just isn't up to par. Stay at the Le Pavillion instead. I know i will.

Reviews.Title: “Location,location,location with a large dose of southern hospitatlity”
Reviews.Author: LSim
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott is the perfect location in this wonderful city! We walked EVERYWHERE! The staff~ I cannot say enough good things about the way we were treated! They go above and beyond with service and their recommrndations were excellent! The rooms~ OK, so maybe they need a little sprucing up! The bathroom configuration in our corner room was a little ridiculous. A larger person would have been VERY incomfortable. However, it was exceptionally clean and very comfortable and quiet! I slept very well, and we were there during the BCS National Championship Game! The bar~ Is small, (OK, intimate) , but everyone is very gracious! After all, this is New Orleans... You can always find a bar! The breakfast~ Is quite wonderful and a great start to an active day in New Orleans! Again, I can only stress that these are some of the best and most memorable staff members we have encountered in recent years. They alone make the stay outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: dagnytaggart
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Marriotts before, though I tend to prefer Starwood Properties. I was in New Orleans for a work event and needed to stay at the JW Marriott, so I was really looking forward to seeing Marriott's "high end" brand. How disappointing. The Lobby and public areas were nice, but the rooms seemed like someone had attempted a token upgrade and skipped the rest. Bed was OK, with modern linens and the desk chair had been replaced to match ones in the lobby. But the aging armoire, chipped paint on the lamps, completely miniature bathroom and lack of solid amenities really marked it as nothing more than a regular Marriott with fancy name. And then there was the weirdness. A mini fridge with a note saying that it's for drinks only because it won't be cold enough to keep food well. Huh? Friends indicated their rooms included flat screen TVs and some other items, which indicates that they might be revamping as they go, but my overall experience is that I could have stayed at the Sheraton for $50 less per night and done much better.

Reviews.Title: “the extra effort”
Reviews.Author: edoogie
Reviews.Content: Anybody looking to visit New Orleans and find the perfect spot to stay should find their way to the J.W. Marriott on Canal Street. It's located in the perfect spot on Canal, a short distance from the wilds of Bourbon St, but within walking distance of everything. My guests and I stayed over Halloween weekend of 2008 and were treated to an exceptional level of southern hospitality that made our first visit to New Orleans even more memorable and special. The rooms were immaculate and spacious enough. The views from the upper floors were wonderful. The concierge staff gave us nothing but excellent recommendations and the hotel's general manager went above and beyond to make sure we were treated like family. Our only regret was that we couldn't stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but a bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: MarcJordan
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott brand implies two things: an upscale property with excellent service. The service at this hotel did fulfill the service portion but I'm afraid the old lady looks a little worn around the edges. The lobby was very nice, but the room was simply ordinary and could easily pass for a typical Marriott. I had an oversized corner room with a view of the quarter, so that was nice. The room had a new LCD TV but the reception on most of the channels was very snowy and was a throwback to the days of rabbit ears. The circa 1995 green Marriott carpet was worn in some areas. The room itself was well insulated and quiet. I didn't hear a peep from anybody. The corridors were freezing at all hours of the day and appear to have been updated recently as the carpet is consistent with the new blue pattern found throughout the Marriott system. I'm a Platinum member in the Marriott Rewards program and had access to the Executive Lounge on the 27th floor. I found it to be well stocked and very nicely decorated. As a plus, they provide a PC with an Internet connection, so checking messages was easy. Over the weekend the lounge is closed but the front desk provided breakfast coupons good for a continental breakfast in the restaurant (Shula's steakhouse). When I sat down and presented the coupon, I was told that for $2 I could take advantage of the full buffet. This proved to be the biggest bargain not only of my trip, but probably the entire year. The buffet was great and offered everything I could possibly want. Outstanding job Shula! The location of this hotel is simply outstanding. Overall my stay was very comfortable but I was expecting a really upscale experience and was disappointed that there doesn't even appear to be any upgrade construction going on. I think the next time I'm in town I'll give their sister properties (Marriott and Renaissance) a try.

Reviews.Title: “10 Days at the JW”
Reviews.Author: Donnas
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a meeting that I was fortunate enough to be a part of the hosting committee...we selected the JW Marriott as our meeting hotel and we made a good decision...from all of our members that attended the meeting (and the hotel was booked by our members)...no one had a complaint what so ever...I think the most frequent request concerning the meeting facilities was the temperature...rather on the chilly side. Being from the south, keep in mind we do like our air conditioning. First and foremost, the staff...excellent! Everyone was extremely pleasant and most helpful. They remembered your name and room and was at our service immediately. THANKS for the attention to details. Our members were very impressed. The guest rooms were great...plenty of room especially for those that were hosting the meeting...boxes stacked everywhere along with normal items (luggage, etc) and still had plenty of room to relax or entertain if necessary. The food was excellent and room service was right on time...sometimes even a little early which is fine with me when you are scheduled for talks or board meetings. My hat is off to the JW Marriott and I want to say THANK YOU for making our national meeting such a big success!

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Platinum Member review”
Reviews.Author: Shortwalk
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the JW Marriott many times both before and after Katrina. Good location with very dated, noisy rooms and poor over all service. Noisy rooms mean every time someone opens and closes there hotel door you can hear it slam and you can hear your neighbors tv and phone calls. Remember, New Orleans is a convention city and a party city which means you get to hear your neighbors coming and going at all hours of the day and night. Quick and easy check in. Poor service for both breakfast and dinner at Don Shulas. Housekeeping does a poor job. Food crumbs still on the floor next to bed from the previous guest after three days. Some days Housekeeping would leave plastic coffee cups, some days they donâ€™t and yes I always leave a tip. If you have a bellman bring your bags down, you tip him. Then a second bell man loads the bags into the car and you tip him. The person who brings your car around wonâ€™t give you the keys or open the trunk or unlock the car until you have tipped him. My business associates are always amazed. The NFL uses this hotel for both visiting teams and referees. I wonder if the NFL gets the same treatment as a Platinum member.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Marriott in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: brooksz
Reviews.Content: This is a standard Marriott -- not sure it is quite the caliber of any other JW Marriott's which I have visited. That said, the hotel is a good location for sampling all the wonderful things in New Orleans. The location on Canal is right across from the French Quarter making it a little quieter than some other area hotels. It is also right on the streetcar route which make it handy for traveling up town. The staff seem a little overwhelmed at times. There is a constant stream of people (primarily conventioneers during my stay) through the hotel. The women staffing the concierge lounge were very good and went out of their way to help identify local restaurants off the beaten path. The hotel restuarant -- Don Shulas -- should be avoided as there is MUCH better food just across the street at The Palace Cafe, Baccos or Acme Oyster. The rooms were good sized but the bathroom was tiny. The amenities were typical Marriott branded products. The towels were a little thin and could use replacing. Shopping is all through the quarter or you can walk about two blocks down Canal to the Shops on Canal where you will find Saks and a few other chain stores. Try Wehmeirs on Toulouse for some great exotic leathers. -- alligator, lizard, etc. Overall I would stay here again because I am a Marriott Platinum member. If not for that, however, I might look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “An embarrassment for the JW Marriott brand”
Reviews.Author: Mooneydriver
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in the New Orleans JW Marriott. The first stay was prior to Katrina and I was quite pleased with the hotel. On this second stay, I was disappointed. In my opinion, this is a poorly-managed and worn-out hotel that no longer deserves the upscale JW Marriott brand. The Marriott across from the Conference Center is a better choice at this time. The rooms at the JW are rather small, but that's the norm in NOLA. I had a corner room with a bit more space. The furniture was rather worn out (not "distressed" to make it look old, but simply frayed and chipped). The TV was old, the picture was fuzzy, and it completely lacked the color red (probably a burned out circuit). Sure, I was not in New Orleans to watch TV, but nevertheless. I had three additional problems with the room (the safe did not work, the light bulb above the shower was burned out, and the shower curtain was dirty). I reported these problems in the morning. The same evening, I returned to my room and surprised to find that the problems were not fixed! I called and talked to the Night Manager, who apologized profusely and promised to send someone right away. They eventually replaced the shower curtain and fixed the safe while I was out for dinner. They never replaced the burned-out light bulb. In general, I found the hotel staff (e.g., porters) to be inattentive and uninterested in their jobs. For example, they opened doors for customers while continuing to chat with their buddies. No big deal, one would say, but this hotel used to have impeccable service prior to Katrina. The Concierge Lounge is large and elegant, with decent views of the French Quarter. They serve an above-average breakfast. Overall, if you demand top-notch service and accommodations, I recommend waiting until Marriott decides to renovate this hotel (and upgrade its management).

Reviews.Title: “St.Patricks Day in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: joshlufsgirl
Reviews.Content: Myself, my two friends and my parents headed down to new orleans for the St.Patricks day holiday. I am a Marriott rewards member, and travel agent-and often travel to Marriott branded properties. I'm also a frequent traveller to New Orleans, and have gotten very accustomed to the different hotels down there. I was very excited to be staying at the JW after staying at Renaissance Arts and loving it (and knowing the JW to be considered a higher calibre of class), however I was displeased upon arrival. The front desk staff was a bit scattered, there was a large conference there, however, it was only my group and another lone single woman in line to check in. Since I checked availability both earlier that morning, (and from my laptop in the room just a little bit later) I knew there were suites available, however, they repeatedly told me that could not upgrade (even when I offered to PAY for the upgrade) because there was no availability. The room: Was tiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiny. Really small. We felt pretty crammed in there (three ladies). The bathroom was nicely appointed, but some of the tiles in the bathroom were Overall we weren't pleased that we paid almost twice as much (then the renaissance) for a smaller room with staff that were less accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Top Non-Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mdcawa
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in some of NO's boutique hotels. I respect those looking for a quaint NO hotel for that authentic experience, but I generally prefer more modern digs. So if you're looking for modern, this hotel is right at the top. Good: nice-sized rooms, great showers w/full compliment of shampoo/conditioner/shower gel/soap/mouthwash (didn't recognize the brand, but I'd buy these products at home), UNBELIEVABLY comfortable beds, good service (easy check-in/out and very good concierge), fast elevators, good in-room coffee selection, in-room safe (very convenient), two really nice robes, free fridge/microwave available upon request, very nice concierge lounge with breakfast (b'fast served at Shula's Steakhouse on weekends--even better, IMO) and hors d'ouvres, decent views, friendly staff, fresh fruit available at front desk, nice workout facility (outdoor pool--didn't use), and VERY convenient location.
